0.title: UK opens new licensing round for oil exploration in North Sea
0.article_body: The UK government has started a fresh licensing round for oil and gas exploration in the North Sea, even as environmentalists have criticised the move. The government contended fuel extraction from the North Sea will create jobs and boost the country's energy security. Climate Minister Graham Stuart said, "When we burn our own gas, it's got lower emissions...than foreign gas."

1.title: Forming CM Shinde's govt took months of planning: Maha minister
1.article_body: Maharashtra minister Chandrakant Patil said the formation of the BJP-Eknath Shinde's Sena government in the state took 'months of planning'. "To keep the morale high...we had to keep saying that 'BJP will soon return to power'...party required 40 MLAs, which was not easy," said Patil. He added that it was "easy" to dislodge the governments in Madhya Pradesh and Karnataka.

2.title: Perhaps saved Assamese society: Cong leader on Shah's 'beaten up' claim
2.article_body: Responding to Union Minister Amit Shah's claim that he was "beaten up" during his visit to Assam by erstwhile CM Hiteswar Saikia, Congress spokesperson Bobbeeta Sharma said Saikia "perhaps...saved Assamese society from dangers of polarization". Recalling his initial days in politics, earlier today, Shah said that he and his fellow ABVP members "were beaten up a lot by Hiteswar Saikia".

3.title: Rahul Gandhi's statement on Savarkar, RSS is full of lies: RSS leader
3.article_body: RSS leader Indresh Kumar on Saturday criticised Congress leader Rahul Gandhi over his statement against VD Savarkar and RSS, calling it "full of lies". "It has become a fashion of Congress to level false allegations against RSS and Savarkar," Kumar said. "This is a form of frustration of Rahul Gandhi's failure in politics," he said, adding Congress divided the country.

4.title: Youngsters will be assigned special roles in next polls: J&K Cong chief
4.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir Congress chief Vikar Rasool Wani promised a special role for youngsters in the next Assembly elections. "Youngsters need to make strenuous efforts to strengthen the party at the grassroot level," Wani said. "The Congress will make the role of the youngsters more vibrant in order to nurture them for future challenges," Wani added.

5.title: 4 including 3 kids killed, 16 hurt as gas cylinders explode in Rajasthan
5.article_body: Four persons, including three children, died and over 16 others sustained injuries after multiple cooking gas cylinders exploded in Rajasthan's Jodhpur, police said on Saturday. The injured persons were taken to Mahatma Gandhi Hospital for treatment. District Collector Himanshu Gupta has ordered a probe into the matter and assured that anyone found responsible would be prosecuted as per law.

6.title: 510 human trafficking cases reported in Germany in 2021: Police
6.article_body: German Police and customs officials responded to 510 human trafficking cases in the country in 2021, which was an increase of 10% from the figure of 2020, the Federal Criminal Police Office said. The average age of the victims was 15 years, it added. The number of children affected due to trafficking was 23% higher in 2021 than in 2020.

7.title: Man tweets pics of glass shards in pizza & tags Mumbai Police, police responds
7.article_body: A man shared pictures of some glass shards that he allegedly found in pizza ordered online from Domino's. "This speaks volumes about global brand food that we're getting," he tweeted while tagging Mumbai Police and FSSAI. "Please write to customer care...If they don't reply or give an unsatisfactory reply, then you can think of a legal remedy," said Police.

8.title: Probe agencies acting on whims: Nitish on chargesheet against Lalu
8.article_body: Bihar CM Nitish Kumar reacted to the CBI chargesheet against RJD President Lalu Prasad Yadav in the land-for-job scam, saying central government probe agencies are "acting upon whims and fancies". "You...may recall what happened...five years ago which caused me to walk out of the alliance...Now that I'm back in alliance (with RJD), a new thing has started," said Kumar.

9.title: BJP will form govt for the 7th time in Gujarat: Ex-CM Vijay Rupani
9.article_body: Gujarat's former CM Vijay Rupani on Saturday said that Bharatiya Janata Party (BJP) leaders are assured that the party will win the upcoming state elections and form government in Gujarat for the seventh time. "Our party will touch more than two-thirds of the majority," he added. He claimed people of Gujarat have no faith in Congress or Aam Aadmi Party.

10.title: Muslim minorities have contributed most to Bollywood: Sharad Pawar
10.article_body: NCP chief Sharad Pawar on Friday said that Muslim minorities have made the biggest contribution to Bollywood. "In all the fields, whether it is art...writing, or...poetry, the highest contribution has come from the Minorities, and...in the Urdu language," Pawar said. "Muslim minorities...have contributed the most [to Bollywood], and we cannot ignore their contribution," he added.

11.title: Drunk woman misbehaves with guard, grabs his collar in Noida society; video viral
11.article_body: In a video that has gone viral on social media, a woman in an inebriated state can be seen misbehaving with a security guard of a building in Uttar Pradesh's Noida after an altercation over some matter. She grabs him by the collar and then throws his cap in the air. The incident reportedly took place at Ajnara Homes society.

12.title: Scripts I'm getting now are better than what I was getting a decade ago: Kareena
12.article_body: Actress Kareena Kapoor Khan said in an interview that it's the "age of actors" today. She added that the scripts she's being offered are "way better" than what she was offered a decade ago. "It's an exciting time not just for female actors but every actor across the board," said Kareena, who was recently seen in 'Laal Singh Chaddha'.

13.title: Plea seeks injunction over 'inaccurate portrayal of Hindu gods' in 'Adipurush'
13.article_body: A plea has been filed in a Delhi court seeking an injunction against the movie 'Adipurush', alleging it has depicted Hindu gods in an "unwarranted" and "inaccurate" way in its teaser. The matter has been listed for hearing on Monday. "The defendants have hurt the religious, cultural, historical and civilizational sentiments of the plaintiff and other Hindus," the plea stated.

14.title: Proud of the way girls came back after loss to Pakistan: Smriti
14.article_body: After India's 59-run win over defending champions Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup 2022, India stand-in captain Smriti Mandhana said it was a total team performance. "It was disappointing in the last match. It is good to come back after that loss, really proud of the girls," she added. India lost their last match against Pakistan by 13 runs.

15.title: 1000s of families benefited: Atlee thanks SRK for shooting Jawan in Chennai
15.article_body: Atlee, director of Shah Rukh Khan's upcoming movie 'Jawan', on Saturday thanked the actor for agreeing to shoot the film in Chennai. He tweeted, "Special thanks to you for having...shoot happen in Chennai, 1000s of family were benefited...'KING IS A KING ALWAYS' a big bow and respect to you sir." Shah Rukh reportedly shot for nearly 30 days in Chennai.

16.title: Cricketers like Hardik Pandya come once in many years: Pollard
16.article_body: West Indies cricketer Kieron Pollard said that players like India's Hardik Pandya come "once in many years". "Let's just enjoy him (Pandya). We tend to put them up on [a] pedestal, and the moment they don't deliver, we drag them down," Pollard said. He added, "I know him for a couple of years and I understand how he thinks."

17.title: 45-yr-old woman killed, 3 others injured in house collapse in Raj
17.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was killed and three others of a family were injured after a wall of their tin-shed house collapsed on Friday in Rajasthan's Baran, police said. Police said 50-year-old Kanshiram Sahariya, his wife Sugna, son Golu and daughter Lila Kumari were asleep when the incident occurred. The woman succumbed to her injuries on the way to the hospital.

18.title: PM Modi to address public rally in Himachal's Chamba on Oct 13
18.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will address a public rally at Himachal Pradesh's Chamba on October 13, marking his second visit to the poll-bound state in less than 10 days. PM Modi will launch 80MW Bajoli hydroelectric project and lay foundation stone of Chanju-III and Deothal Chanju hydel projects, CM Jairam Thakur said. He will also launch Pradhan Mantri Gram Sadak Yojana-III.

19.title: India beat defending champions Bangladesh in Women's Asia Cup
19.article_body: India defeated defending champions Bangladesh by 59 runs in Women's Asia Cup on Saturday. Opener Shafali Verma, adjudged 'Player of the Match', scored 55 runs off 44 balls and returned bowling figures of 4-0-10-2, while all-rounder Deepti Sharma picked up two wickets. Opting to bat, India scored 159/5 in 20 overs. Bangladesh managed 100/7 in 20 overs.

20.title: Sena Bhawan employee arrested for spying for Pakistan
20.article_body: A 31-year-old man has been arrested for allegedly spying for Pakistani intelligence agencies, Rajasthan Police said on Saturday. Ravi Prakash Meena, a resident of Rajasthan, was posted as a class-4 employee at the Sena Bhawan in Delhi, police informed. Meena was honey-trapped by a female Pakistani agent with whom he was sharing confidential and strategic information about the Indian Army.

21.title: Remote-control allegations insulting to Cong Prez candidates: Rahul
21.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday claimed that whoever is elected as the party's new President next month, "will not be remote-controlled" by the Gandhi family and will have a free hand in taking decisions. Senior leaders Mallikarjun Kharge and Shashi Tharoor are fighting for the top post. "Frankly, this tone is insulting to both of them," Gandhi added.

22.title: Heavy to very heavy rainfall warning issued for several states till Oct 12, list released
22.article_body: Heavy to very heavy rainfall is likely over Tamil Nadu and Puducherry on October 9, while it's likely over Uttarakhand and Uttar Pradesh on October 12, as per the IMD. Meanwhile, heavy rainfall is likely over West Bengal, Sikkim, Arunachal Pradesh, Assam and Meghalaya till October 12. Further, it is likely over Madhya Pradesh, Nagaland and Manipur till October 11.

23.title: Rape on pretext of marriage claim not valid if woman has sex knowing man is married: HC
23.article_body: The allegation of rape on the false promise of marriage does not stand if a woman continues to have sexual relations with a man despite knowledge about his married status, the Kerala High Court has said. It said this while quashing a rape case against a 33-year-old man. The relationship between him and the complainant seemed consensual, the HC said.

24.title: Mentally-ill man beaten on suspicion of being child lifter in Chhattisgarh
24.article_body: A mentally-challenged man roaming around Chhattisgarh's Khopli village was allegedly beaten up by a mob on Friday on suspicion of being a child lifter, police said. The victim, who did not suffer injuries in the incident, was rescued by police officers and shifted to a Bilaspur-based government hospital for mentally-challenged people. Police arrested three people aged between 20 and 37.

25.title: I'm back to 100%: England captain Buttler ahead of T20I series vs Australia
25.article_body: Ahead of England-Australia three-match T20I series, England captain Jos Buttler, who sustained a calf injury during The Hundred in August, said, "I'm back to 100 percent." He added, "Had a good time in Pakistan rehabbing, probably could have played earlier, but with...World Cup around the corner, it was the right thing to do." Buttler missed the T20I series against Pakistan.

26.title: 4 masked men rob retired magistrate of laptop, ₹10,500 cash in Raj
26.article_body: Four masked men robbed the house of a retired magistrate named Aditya Narayan Sharma in Rajasthan, police said on Saturday. The armed criminals stole a laptop, a mobile phone, some artificial jewellery and ₹10,500 in cash from his house in Jaipur's Mansarovar area. Police said they are trying to identify the criminals through footage from cameras installed in the area.

27.title: Ranbir Kapoor stops accepting film offers, decides to take paternity leave: Report
27.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor has decided to take paternity leave once his baby is born, said reports. Ranbir, who is completing his work on Sandeep Vanga's 'Animal', hasn't accepted any other project as of now, and will do so only after his paternity leave, reports added. Actress Alia Bhatt will reportedly return to work as soon as she can after delivery.

28.title: 'Anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back' banners emerge in Guj ahead of AAP rally
28.article_body: Banners showing Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal wearing a white skull cap surfaced in Gujarat ahead of the AAP leader's rally in the state on Saturday. Some banners bearing his pictures carried lines like "I consider Hindu religion as madness", while others bore "anti-Hindu Kejriwal go back" message. This comes after Delhi minister Rajendra Pal Gautam attended a religious conversion event.

29.title: Kejriwal promises free Ayodhya Ram Temple visit for Guj residents
29.article_body: AAP National Convenor and Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal, while addressing a gathering in poll-bound Gujarat, promised "free visit to Ayodhya's Ram Temple to people of Gujarat", if the AAP forms the government in the state. This comes after banners and posters calling Kejriwal "anti-Hindu" and showing him purportedly wearing a skull cap surfaced in several cities in the state.

30.title: UP man ends life by hanging from tree after being scolded by parents
30.article_body: A man allegedly ended his life by hanging himself from a tree near Risaura village in Banda, UP on Saturday. The deceased, Deepu Nishad (22), was hurt after being scolded by his parents and this seems to be one of the main reasons behind his death, police said. Notably, police have started with their investigation.

31.title: There's no fight between us: Ali Asgar on equation with Kapil Sharma
31.article_body: Actor-comedian Ali Asgar, speaking about his equation with Kapil Sharma, said, "There were times when I missed his call and on other times, he missed my calls." "There is no fight or anger between us," he added. "I am not rigid about not being part of The Kapil Sharma Show again," said Ali, who quit the show in 2017.

32.title: MCD Special Officer appointed as Principal Secy in Delhi Home Dept
32.article_body: Special Officer of the Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) Ashwani Kumar has been appointed as Principal Secretary (Home) of the Delhi government, an order issued by Lieutenant Governor VK Saxena stated. The 1992 batch IAS officer will continue to hold the charge of Special Officer of MCD. Kumar was appointed as Special Officer by the Home Ministry in May 2022.

33.title: Man stabs mother-in-law to death over property dispute in Telangana
33.article_body: A 45-year-old woman was reportedly stabbed to death by her son-in-law over a property dispute in Telangana's Karimnagar. The accused, along with two of his family members, also attacked the victim's mother, who was sleeping with her. According to police, the victim, a widow, owned five-acre land, and the accused had been asking for a share in her property.

34.title: BJP the only ideology-based party in the country: Nadda in Guwahati
34.article_body: BJP chief JP Nadda said the Congress does not have any particular ideology and BJP is the only ideology-based national party in India. Speaking at the inauguration of Atal Bihari Vajpayee Bhawan in Guwahati, he said, the BJP proposed to set up 512 offices across the country, out of which 236 offices have been constructed and 154 are under construction.

35.title: EOW inspector, ex-Mumbai Police officers booked for filing fake case
35.article_body: Mumbai Police has registered a case against seven persons, including two of its retired officers and an Economic Offences Wing (EOW) inspector, for allegedly getting an MHADA official jailed in a false case. The complainant alleged that police fabricated evidence and witnesses against him. The official was accused of cheating people on the pretext of providing flats at cheap rates.

36.title: Liquor sale banned in east B'luru tomorrow on account of Eid-e-Milad
36.article_body: On account of Eid-e-Milad-un-Nabi on Sunday, police have banned the sale of liquor in parts of east Bengaluru. Clubs and five-star hotels in the area have, however, been exempted from the ban. "On the occasion of Eid-e-Milad, there will be processions...to maintain peace and security the sale of liquor is prohibited," an order issued by the city Police Commissioner stated.

37.title: Delhi civic ward delimitation report to be sent to Centre next week: Officials
37.article_body: The panel, which is tasked with the delimitation exercise of civic wards in Delhi, is expected to present its report next week to the Union Home Ministry, officials said. The panel's draft report has reduced the number of wards in Delhi from 272 to 250. It also suggested that the number of municipalities in the 23 Assembly constituencies be reduced.

38.title: Few Mumbai Central Railway suburban lines to be blocked tomorrow
38.article_body: The Central Railway in Mumbai said services on some of its suburban rail lines will be blocked due to maintenance work on Sunday. Thane-Kalyan Up and Down fast lines and Kurla-Vashi Up and Down Harbour lines will be blocked till around 4 pm. Meanwhile, some Down fast services leaving CSMT and Up fast/semi-fast train services leaving Kalyan will be diverted.

39.title: Proposal to create 79 posts in Thane's disaster response team approved
39.article_body: Maharashtra CM Eknath Shinde on Friday approved the proposal to create 79 posts in the Disaster Response Team of Thane Municipal Corporation (TMC) due to increasing urbanisation and natural calamities. "Now there will be 79 more posts, including the post of commandant of Class II, three deputy commandant of Class III and 75...responders," Thane's Regional Disaster Management Cell chief said.

40.title: Rail traffic in northern Germany disrupted by alleged sabotage
40.article_body: Rail traffic in northern Germany came to a three-hour halt on Saturday due to a suspected act of sabotage, state-owned rail operator Deutsche Bahn (DB) said. An investigation into the incident has been launched, DB added. Notably, the EU and NATO last month stressed the need to protect critical infrastructure after leaks were detected on the Nord Stream gas pipelines.

41.title: Shehnaaz Gill's father gets death threats, told on call 'Will kill you before Diwali'
41.article_body: Actress Shehnaaz Gill's father Santokh Singh recently received death threats from an unknown person via phone call. The caller reportedly abused Santokh on the call and told that he'd kill him at his home before Diwali. Santokh has filed a police complaint. He got the call while he was going from Punjab's Beas to Tarn Taran.

42.title: World's largest portrait of Queen Elizabeth created over UK skies by pilot, pic viral
42.article_body: A pilot named Amal Larhlid created the world's largest portrait of Queen Elizabeth on October 6. She did it through a flight path that covered 413 km, creating a portrait 105 km tall and 63 km wide northwest of London. Flightradar24 shared the tribute on Twitter, adding that Larhlid also intended to raise money for Hospice UK.

43.title: Ox kills 1, injures 8 at Durga idol immersion carnival in Bengal
43.article_body: A man was killed and eight others were injured after an ox went on a rampage at a Durga idol immersion carnival in West Bengal's Raiganj on Friday night. The incident took place when the Durga Puja committee arranged for ox-drawn carriages to showcase the idols during the procession. The deceased's daughter has demanded ex-gratia compensation from the state government.

44.title: Man-eating tiger which killed 10 people shot dead in Bihar
44.article_body: A three-year-old tiger, which had killed at least 10 people in and around Valmiki Tiger Reserve (VTR) in Bihar's West Champaran since September, was on Saturday shot dead by forest officials, as per reports. This comes after the Bihar government on Friday directed the state Environment, Forest and Climate Change Department to shoot the man-eating tiger.

45.title: Militants kidnap Pak minister after blocking road, release him after negotiations
45.article_body: Militants on Friday kidnapped senior Pakistan minister Abaidullah Baig after blocking a road connecting the Khyber Pakhtunkhwa and Gilgit-Baltistan regions. Baig was released on Saturday morning after negotiations with the militants who are reportedly seeking the release of some of their accomplices. The abduction was perpetrated by the most-wanted militant commander Habibur Rahman, reports said.

46.title: Pune civic body bans illegal firecracker stalls on footpaths, roads
46.article_body: Ahead of Diwali, the Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) is enforcing a total ban on the sale of firecrackers by illegal stalls on footpaths, roads and congested areas. Deputy Municipal Commissioner Madhav Jagtap said the move is in line with the Supreme Court's directions. In 2018, the state government asked PMC to take steps in accordance with the Supreme Court's directions.

47.title: Vice-Admiral Sarin takes charge as Commandant of AFMC in Pune
47.article_body: Surgeon Vice-Admiral Arti Sarin has assumed charge as the new Director and Commandant of the Armed Forces Medical College (AFMC) in Pune. Vice-Admiral Sarin, a graduate of the AFMC herself, was conferred with the Vishisht Seva Medal in 2021. She has served as the Head of the Department of Radiation Oncology Army Hospital R&R Delhi and Command Hospital/AFMC Pune.

48.title: 2 Palestinian teenagers fatally shot by Israeli forces
48.article_body: Two Palestinian teenagers were shot dead by the Israeli army in two separate incidents of clashes in the West Bank on Friday, Palestinian officials said. In one of the incidents, the Israeli army said its troops opened fire in response to a suspect hurling firebombs. Meanwhile, near Ramallah, soldiers responded with gunfire after encountering rock-throwing protesters, the army added.

49.title: Which Alauddin Khilji applies Tilak: Manoj on criticism over Saif's Raavan look
49.article_body: 'Adipurush' dialogue writer Manoj Muntashir reacted to controversy over Saif Ali Khan's look as Raavan in the film. Following the release of its teaser, many on social media compared his look to Ranveer Singh's Khilji in 'Padmaavat'. Manoj said, "Which Alauddin Khilji wears Rudraksha...and applies Tilak on...forehead." He added the film is being judged on the basis of one-minute-long teaser.

50.title: Would like to be in films that offer me more scope & time: Radhika Apte
50.article_body: Actress Radhika Apte said she would definitely like to be in films that offer her more scope and time. Talking about 'Vikram Vedha', Radhika said, "I knew the story was about two men. My part was always going to be small." "That said, it's not about screen time...It's a good film, and that matters to me," she added.

51.title: I've been a big fan of him: Vivian Richards on India captain Rohit
51.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma, ex-West Indies captain Vivian Richards said, "I have been a big fan of Rohit even before he became the captain." He added, "I have always liked Rohit and especially when Virat Kohli was the captain." Rohit, who made his India debut in June 2007, became India's captain across all three formats in February this year.

52.title: Bharat Rashtra Samithi's main focus is 2024 Lok Sabha polls: KTR
52.article_body: Bharat Rashtra Samithi (BRS) leader and Telangana minister KT Rama Rao said his party's main focus now is the 2024 Lok Sabha elections. Telangana Rashtra Samithi (TRS) was named BRS, after the party decided to go national. Rao said his party would like to focus on Maharashtra and Karnataka as the good work done in Telangana is best known there.

53.title: Five Hong Kong teenagers sentenced for urging 'armed revolution'
53.article_body: A court on Saturday sentenced five teenagers with a Hong Kong group to up to three years in detention at a correctional facility for urging an "armed revolution" against the Chinese state. They had pleaded guilty to "inciting others to subvert state power" in a national security case. "There's no evidence to...prove anyone was incited...but this...risk exists," the court said.

54.title: Really glad that Ajay Devgn is doing 'Kaithi' remake: Karthi on 'Bholaa'
54.article_body: Actor Karthi has said he's looking forward to the Hindi version of his Tamil film 'Kaithi'. Titled 'Bholaa', the remake will feature Ajay Devgn and Tabu, among others. "A lot of people called me and they wanted to buy...rights to Kaithi, but then Ajay sir was the first one to get it. I'm really glad...he's doing the remake," Karthi said.

55.title: Ranveer Singh teaches 'Tattad Tattad' steps to NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo, video viral
55.article_body: A video of actor Ranveer Singh teaching 'Tattad Tattad' steps to NBA star Giannis Antetokounmpo has gone viral. Sharing the video on Instagram, Ranveer wrote, "The Greek Freak gettin' his Tattad Tattad on!" A fan commented, "The crossover we didn't know we needed." "Haha legend," cricketer Shreyas Iyer commented on the video.

56.title: Which Hrithik Roshan films have clocked ₹100 crore globally?
56.article_body: 'Vikram Vedha' has become Hrithik Roshan's 13th movie to cross the ₹100-crore mark globally. The first film of Hrithik to gross ₹100 crore was 'Kabhi Khushi Kabhie Gham' and it was followed by 'Krrish', 'Dhoom 2', 'Jodhaa Akbar', 'Zindagi Na Milegi Dobara', 'Agneepath', 'Krrish 3', 'Bang Bang', 'Mohenjo Daro', 'Kaabil', 'Super 30' and 'War'.

57.title: Hrithik's rumoured girlfriend Saba calls out woman mocking her look, shares screenshot
57.article_body: Actor Hrithik Roshan's rumoured girlfriend Saba Azad took to her Instagram Stories to call out a troll for mocking her look. "You were looking like chheeee (yuck), eeew, yaak, whatever you understand...Take it," the woman had commented. Saba wrote, "This is Shruti...She...just follows me to share her abundant hate...There are many like her out there...Don't be like Shruti."

58.title: Policeman shoots repeatedly at teen eating burger inside car in US, video surfaces
58.article_body: A policeman in US' Texas was fired after he shot and wounded a 17-year-old who was sitting in his car and eating a hamburger. Footage of the October 2 incident showed James Brennand firing several shots at Erik Cantu in a McDonald's parking lot. Cantu was initially charged with evading detention and assaulting Brennand but the charges were later dropped.

59.title: 93 persons jailed for drunk driving in Cyberabad in September
59.article_body: As many as 93 persons, who were caught by Cyberabad Traffic Police in September and booked for drunk driving, were sent to jail on Friday. A fine of ₹1.2 crore was imposed on them. As per the police, the offenders were among 4,333 persons held for drunk driving and without a driving licence at various locations under Cyberabad Commissionerate.

60.title: Kangana Ranaut starrer 'Tejas' to release in summer 2023: Reports
60.article_body: Kangana Ranaut starrer 'Tejas' is expected to release in mid-summer 2023, recent reports stated. Kangana will portray the role of an Indian Air Force pilot in the movie. "The aircraft dog fights and VFX are taking time...Director Sarvesh Mewara is leaving no stone unturned...to meet the VFX for...next summer release," a source said as quoted by Bollywood Hungama.

61.title: CAQM asks distributors to develop gas infra in NCR before next winter
61.article_body: The Commission for Air Quality Management (CAQM) held a review meeting with the gas distributors of the NCR and officials of Petroleum Ministry. It directed the distributors to develop a proper gas infrastructure before the next winter. According to officials, NCR currently has 963 CNG stations, around 2.2 million domestic PNG connections and 5,361 industrial connections.

62.title: Over 62,000 Russian soldiers killed in war so far, claims Ukraine
62.article_body: Ukraine on Saturday claimed that its forces have killed around 62,060 Russian soldiers since Moscow's invasion began on February 24. Russia has also lost 1,459 artillery systems, 2,472 tanks and 5,111 armoured personnel vehicles, Ukraine's Foreign Ministry said. Ukrainian troops have also destroyed 500 aircraft, including 234 helicopters, and 345 Multiple Launch Rocket Systems, the ministry added.

63.title: Neighbour kills girl to take revenge against her brother in Delhi
63.article_body: An eight-year-old girl was allegedly killed by her neighbour in north Delhi's Narela area, police said on Saturday. Upon interrogation, it was revealed that the accused committed the murder to take revenge against the victim's brother with whom he had a strained relationship. The girl's disappearance was reported to police around 10 pm on Friday. Her body has been recovered.

64.title: Delhi-Varanasi Vande Bharat Express train halted after suffering technical failure
64.article_body: The Delhi-Varanasi Vande Bharat Express train was halted in UP's Khurja after developing a failure, railway officials said. The train reportedly suffered a jammed wheel following which on-ground staff alerted the operations control to halt the train. The passengers of the Varanasi-bound train were shifted to Shatabdi Express at Khurja Junction.

65.title: Indian team hungry for podium finish at hockey WC 2023: Midfielder Hardik
65.article_body: Indian men's hockey team midfielder Hardik Singh said his side is capable of reaching the hockey World Cup 2023 final and winning it. "We didn't do well last time, but now after...Tokyo Olympics, things have changed overall for Indian hockey...The whole team is very hungry to get success this year and we want to finish on the podium," he added.

66.title: US will hurt, isolate itself: China on US rules limiting chip export
66.article_body: China termed US' new export policy limiting the sale of certain semiconductor chips to China as an abuse of trade measures and designed to maintain the country's "technological hegemony". "US will only hurt and isolate itself," China's Foreign Ministry said. The policy includes a measure to cut China off from certain chips made anywhere in the world with US equipment.

67.title: 72-year-old booked for shooting woman with airgun in Mumbai
67.article_body: A 72-year-old man was booked for allegedly injuring a female cyclist while trying to shoot a stray dog with an airgun in Vasai, Mumbai. The victim, Sarita Bhoir (28), who works as a housemaid, was going to her home when the accused, Michael Coutinho, shot at her thigh, police said. Coutinho allegedly ran inside his bungalow instead of helping Bhoir.

68.title: Chhattisgarh government to provide free WiFi services to 108 villages in Bastar
68.article_body: The Chhattisgarh government has announced plans to provide free Wi-Fi connectivity to 108 villages in Bastar district under an agreement with BSNL. The connectivity will be available at Haat Bazaar, Panchayat Bhawan and other public places possessing a speed of 10 MBPS. Under the programme, 73 Bastar villages and 35 Tokapal development blocks will get the free services.

69.title: 2 persons on scooter die in road accident in UP's Saharanpur
69.article_body: Two persons, including a trader, died in a road accident in Nakur in UP's Saharanpur. The deceased, Ashok Kumar (35) and grocery merchant Anil Gupta (50), were travelling on a scooter when they were hit by an unknown vehicle, police said. Notably, Ashok died on the spot, while Anil succumbed to his injuries at a hospital, police said.

70.title: Haiti asks for international military assistance amid growing unrest
70.article_body: Haiti has asked for international military assistance to curb its gang violence crisis, which has paralysed the country, according to a document published on Friday. The document, signed by Prime Minister Ariel Henry and other top-ranking officials, states that they're alarmed by "the risk of a major humanitarian crisis" that is threatening the lives of many people in the country.

71.title: 9,000 people laid down arms in Assam under BJP Government: Amit Shah
71.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah hailed development work in the northeastern region and said that the BJP government has established peace in Assam with 9,000 people laying down arms. He claimed that Congress’ 70 years of rule had pushed the northeast into violence and anarchy. "During Congress' rule, there was a process of breaking India in the northeast," said Shah.

72.title: Tracxn Technologies raises nearly ₹139 crore from anchor investors
72.article_body: Tracxn Technologies has raised a little more than ₹139 crore from anchor investors. BNP Paribas Arbitrage, WhiteOak Capital Management, Kotak Mutual Fund, ICICI Prudential Mutual Fund, Nippon India Mutual Fund, and Reliance General Insurance are among the anchor investors. Tracxn was launched in 2015 by Neha Singh and Abhishek Goyal.

73.title: Do take part: PM as auction of his mementoes extended till Oct 12
73.article_body: PM Narendra Modi on Friday urged people to take part in the e-auction of mementoes he has received over the years. He tweeted that the framed Replica of Kedarnath Temple, which is up for auction, is among the many special gifts he has received. "Respecting people's wishes, the auction of the mementoes has been extended till [October 12]," he added.

74.title: Zaporizhzhia nuclear plant disconnected from power due to shelling: Ukraine
74.article_body: Russia-occupied Zaporizhzhia nuclear power plant in Ukraine lost connection to external power supply due to shelling, Ukraine's state nuclear company Energoatom said, blaming Russia. The company said the available supplies of diesel for operation in this mode will be enough for 10 days. International Atomic Energy Agency recently said the danger of a catastrophic accident has not been averted.

75.title: Man in UK charged ₹32 lakh for a 15-minute Uber ride
75.article_body: A man was charged £35,427.92 (₹32.5 lakh) for a 15-minute Uber ride in UK. He stated he booked the cab to a pub when the price was displayed as £11-£12. On seeing the bill the next morning, he approached Uber, who informed him due to an error drop-off location was set to Australia and their engineers are looking into it.

76.title: I'm very close to Vijay Deverakonda, we share & discuss things: Rashmika
76.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna, who is rumoured to be dating Vijay Deverakonda, said she is very close to the actor and often shares and discusses things with him. "I am very close to Vijay, which is why if I feel like asking about anything in the industry, I go and ask him. He is always there (for me)," Rashmika said.

77.title: Bail plea of man booked under UAPA in 2020 Delhi riots case rejected
77.article_body: A Delhi court rejected the bail plea of a man booked under the Unlawful Activities (Prevention) Act (UAPA) in connection with a 2020 northeast Delhi riots case. He attended "conspiratorial meetings" and was also one of the organisers of the Chand Bagh protest site, the court said. The accused has been in judicial custody since June 25, 2020.

78.title: Heard loud noise & came out, lucky to survive: Nashik bus fire survivor
78.article_body: A survivor in the Nashik bus fire incident that took place on Saturday that claimed the lives of 11 people, said that she heard a loud noise. "We were sleeping in the bus...The bus had caught fire. Somehow, I managed to get out of the bus along with my daughter...We are lucky to have survived," she added.

79.title: Bank credit growth jumps to 16.28% for fortnight ended September 23
79.article_body: Bank credit growth rose to 16.28% for the fortnight ended September 23, the Reserve Bank of India said. The overall non-food credit stood at ₹130.06 lakh crore as on September 23 as against ₹111.85 lakh crore in the year-ago period. The deposit growth was at 8.96% for the fortnight with overall deposits at ₹174.54 lakh crore.

80.title: Bandhan Bank posts advances, deposits growth in excess of 20% each
80.article_body: Kolkata-based Bandhan Bank posted an over 20% growth in advances and deposits each during the September quarter. Its gross advances increased 22% from last year to nearly ₹1 lakh crore. However, the figure doesn't include any potential write-offs. Deposits of the bank also neared the ₹1-lakh-crore mark, increasing 21% year-on-year during the said quarter.

81.title: Fire breaks out on 12th floor of building in Mumbai; residents seen trying to escape
81.article_body: A fire broke out on the 12th floor of a residential building in the New Tilak Nagar area in Mumbai's Chembur around 2.43 pm on Saturday, Mumbai Fire Brigade (MFB) said. No loss of life has been reported yet, it added. Pictures from the site have surfaced online wherein residents can be seen trying to escape.

82.title: Masood Bhai is force behind GodFather's success: Chiranjeevi thanks Salman
82.article_body: Actor Chiranjeevi took to Instagram to congratulate his 'GodFather' co-star Salman Khan for the success of the film. He said that Salman's character, Vettavaliyan Masood Bhai, was the "force behind GodFather's stupendous success". "Thank you and I love you so much. Vande Mataram," he added. Salman made a cameo appearance in the film, which was directed by Mohan Raja.

83.title: GHMC to set up 90 km of cycling tracks across Hyderabad
83.article_body: The Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation (GHMC) is planning to set up 90 km of cycling tracks in major areas of Hyderabad. The civic body aims to lay out both permanent and artificial tracks. Permanent cycling tracks will be laid from Habsiguda crossroads to Uppal crossroads, from Bairamalguda crossroads to Owaisi Junction and from Aramghar to Owaisi Junction, among other locations.

84.title: Ghaziabad family robbed of valuables worth ₹20 lakh at gunpoint
84.article_body: A family was at gunpoint robbed of cash and jewellery worth ₹20 lakh at their home in Ghaziabad's Nehru Nagar on Friday afternoon, police informed. According to the house owner, Raman Sareen, three robbers tried to enter his house claiming that they had come on his behalf. Sareen's wife and daughter were at home when the incident occurred, he said.

85.title: Won't do a project like this because of my upbringing: Prem Sagar on Adipurush
85.article_body: Ramanand Sagar's son Prem Sagar, reacting to ongoing controversy surrounding Om Raut's 'Adipurush', said, "How can you stop anyone from creating anything?" "He (Om Raut) hasn't called it Ramayan...He has the right to do it," Prem said, adding, "If I'd got...project like this...I wouldn't do it because of my upbringing." Ramanand directed 'Ramayan', which featured Arun Govil as Lord Ram.

86.title: Rivian to recall nearly all delivered EVs in US to fix defect
86.article_body: US-based electric vehicle maker Rivian will recall nearly all its vehicles delivered to customers after discovering that a fastener "may not have been sufficiently torqued", company's CEO RJ Scaringe said in a letter. The company is recalling about 13,000 vehicles after the issue was discovered in seven. The recall covers vehicles delivered since Rivian began production late last year.

87.title: Video shows the moment truck bomb exploded on key bridge linking Russia with Crimea
87.article_body: A CCTV footage showing the moment a truck bomb exploded on the key bridge linking Russia with Crimea has surfaced online. A large part of the bridge was engulfed in fire because of the explosion, which had also set ablaze seven oil tankers. The bridge was unveiled in 2018, after Crimea was annexed from Ukraine in 2014.

88.title: Telangana man sentenced to life term for setting wife on fire 6 yrs ago
88.article_body: A man in Telangana has been sentenced to life term for setting his wife on fire after pouring kerosene on her almost six years ago. Police said the wife had, before passing away, told them that the accused was addicted to alcohol and had abused her on December 24, 2016. He had set her on fire after doubting her fidelity.

89.title: Credit guarantee scheme for startups notified for loans up to ₹10 cr
89.article_body: The Department for Promotion of Industry and Internal Trade has notified the establishment of the Credit Guarantee Scheme for Startups. The scheme will provide credit guarantees up to a specified limit against loans extended by financial institutions registered with SEBI. Exposure of individual cases would be capped at ₹10 crore, or the actual outstanding credit amount, whichever is less.

90.title: Musi river in Hyderabad most polluted in Telangana: NGT report
90.article_body: Musi river in Hyderabad has earned the distinction of being the most polluted river in Telangana in the latest National Green Tribunal (NGT) report. As per the report, high levels of coliform were discovered in the river, along with imbalanced levels of dissolved oxygen (DO) and biological oxygen demand (BOD). The report also tagged Nagole as the most polluted location.

91.title: 40-yr-old businessman shot, injured by unidentified man in Thane
91.article_body: A 40-year-old businessman, Sandeep Adsul, was shot and injured by an unidentified man in Thane, police said. The incident took place in Majiwada area on Friday evening, when Adsul, who operates a stone-crushing business, was standing outside his house, an official from Kapurbawdi police station said. A monetary transaction may be a motive for the attack, the official added.

92.title: Closure report filed in case against ex-Pune Police Commissioner
92.article_body: The police have filed a closure report against former Pune Police Commissioner Rashmi Shukla in the case regarding the alleged illegal phone tapping of a political leader, Pune Police Commissioner Amitabh Gupta said. The police filed a 'C summary' report, which is filed when the case was registered due to a "mistake" or the complaint is civil in nature.

93.title: Assam CM Himanta Sarma washes feet of senior BJP leaders, shares video
93.article_body: Assam Chief Minister Himanta Biswa Sarma washed the feet of senior Bharatiya Janata Party leaders. He took to Twitter to share a video showing the same. "Honoured to have washed the feet of our respected senior BJP functionaries whose immense contributions helped strengthen our party's base in the early phase in Assam," he wrote.

94.title: National Games gold is reassuring my preparations are on right track: Atanu
94.article_body: Archer Atanu Das of West Bengal won men's individual recurve gold at 36th National Games, beating Services' Gurcharan Besra 6-4 in final on Thursday. "The upcoming year is very important for us. This gold is reassuring that my preparations are on...right track," he said. Atanu hasn't been able to make it to the Indian squad since his Tokyo Olympics performance.

95.title: 3 women arrested for killing woman, dumping her body in Mumbai
95.article_body: Three women were arrested for allegedly killing a woman and later dumping her body after stuffing it in a gunny bag in a nullah in Nehru Nagar, Mumbai. One of the suspects, Minal Pawar (25), was suspicious about the deceased being in an illicit relationship with her husband, therefore, she, along with her sister and friend, killed her, police said.

96.title: Bihar issues order to kill man-eating tiger in Valmiki Tiger Reserve
96.article_body: The forest authorities on Friday issued an order to kill a man-eating tiger in Bihar's Valmiki Tiger Reserve. "A team of shooters is on the job," said an official. The tiger has reportedly killed five people in the last few days, including a man in his 30s and a 12-year-old girl within a span of about 24 hours.

97.title: RSS was helping Britishers & Savarkar was getting stipend: Rahul
97.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Saturday criticised the BJP and RSS, claiming that VD Savarkar was receiving a stipend from the British and that the RSS was helping the Britishers. "BJP was nowhere to be found in the freedom struggle. The BJP can't hide such facts. Congress and its leaders fought for freedom," said Rahul Gandhi.

98.title: Class 7 girl in Odisha tribal hostel dies day after delivering stillborn
98.article_body: A Class 7 girl studying in a tribal residential school in Odisha's Kandhamal died a day after she delivered a stillborn baby, officials said. The girl was found to be four months pregnant on September 23 following which she was kept in a childcare institution. A Class 10 student of another residential school was detained in connection with the case.

99.title: Epics like Ramayana cannot be made with technology: Mukesh Khanna
99.article_body: Reacting to the teaser of 'Adipurush' actor Mukesh Khanna said epics like Ramayana and Mahabharata cannot be made with technology. "Some people say, 'Who are you to object when the Censor Board has passed it?' Censor Board...hamara mai baap nahi hai (not our guardian)," he said. "Make 1,000 stories, but do not make fun of our deities," he added.

100.title: 7 people killed in explosion at gas station in Ireland
100.article_body: At least seven people were killed in an explosion at a gas station in northwest Ireland on Friday, police said on Saturday. "[It is] a shocking toll and there will be more, and it's a search operation now," Irish Prime Minister Micheal Martin said. He added that the entire country was numbed by the "utter devastation".

101.title: Development in J&K PM Modi's biggest achievement: Jitendra Singh
101.article_body: Union Minister Jitendra Singh hailed PM Modi and called development in J&K his biggest achievement. He said that PM Modi ensured that all the concerns of the people were addressed sensitively. "It is the biggest achievement of PM Modi that in 70 years, each division of J&K has a common allocation for the proposed development projects," said Singh.

102.title: Russian & Turkish Presidents discuss bilateral ties & ending Ukraine war
102.article_body: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan held a phone conversation with Russian President Vladimir Putin during which he reiterated Ankara's willingness to play its role in peacefully resolving the war in Ukraine, Erdogan's office said. The two leaders also discussed bilateral ties. Turkey is a NATO member which has rejected sanctions on Moscow but also criticised Russian invasion of Ukraine.

103.title: Man sent to morgue in Australia was alive, tried to get out of body bag: Reports
103.article_body: A 55-year-old man, who was declared dead and sent to a morgue at a hospital in Australia, was alive, reports said. Kevin Reid's body was placed in a resting position, however, doctor reportedly found that the body was lying differently than how the staff had described it. Reports further said that he tried to get out of the body bag.

104.title: Thought me wearing it was funny: Kanye after backlash over 'White Lives Matter' shirt
104.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has addressed the backlash and criticism he received for wearing a t-shirt with the controversial 'White Lives Matter' slogan that's often associated with white supremacy. Kanye said he "thought the shirt was a funny shirt" and that the idea of him wearing it was "funny". He said his father, an ex-Black Panther member, also found it funny.

105.title: CBI files charge-sheet against Anubrata Mondal in cattle smuggling case
105.article_body: CBI has filed a charge-sheet against Trinamool Congress leader Anubrata Mondal before a special court in West Bengal's Asansol in connection with the cattle smuggling case. "During the period 2014-18, Mondal had allegedly accumulated huge properties in and around Bolpur and Kolkata in his name and family members by using illegal cash received in cattle smuggling," CBI claimed.

106.title: Won't be a remote control of Sonia Gandhi: Mallikarjun Kharge
106.article_body: Senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge rejected claims that he would act as a remote control of current Congress chief Sonia Gandhi if he becomes the party's President. "People say I am a remote control...They say I will do what Sonia Gandhi will say. Let me tell you that there is no such thing as remote control in Congress," Kharge said.

107.title: 26 bodies recovered in U'khand avalanche mishap, search on for 3 trainees
107.article_body: A total of 26 bodies have been recovered so far from the site of the avalanche that took place in Uttarakhand on October 4. Reports said that a search and rescue operation is in progress for the remaining three mountaineers. An update by the Nehru Institute of Mountaineering confirmed the number of bodies found on October 4, 6 and 7.

108.title: Felt shy going to male gynaecologist as a teenager: Rakul
108.article_body: Rakul Preet Singh in an interview spoke about her upcoming movie 'Doctor G', which stars Ayushmann Khurrana as a male gynaecologist. She said she felt shy going to a male gynaecologist as a teenager. "When I grew older...I realised that's not how you look at it," she said, adding, "And that's the conversation even in the trailer."

109.title: Not against Adani, but against monopolisation of businesses: Rahul
109.article_body: Congress leader Rahul Gandhi said that he is not "against the corporates but against the complete monopolisation of businesses as that weakens the country". Gandhi's statement came after he was asked about the recent announcement by the Adani Group of investing ₹65,000 crore in Congress-ruled Rajasthan. "Government has not used political power to help Adani in Rajasthan," Gandhi said.

110.title: Policemen make miscreants blow trumpets into each other's ears as punishment in MP
110.article_body: Policemen in MP's Jabalpur made several youths, who were caught blowing trumpets into passersby's ears, do the same to each other as punishment. A video of the incident showed the police telling the miscreants to blow the toy trumpets into each other's ears and making them do sit-ups. The video went viral with many Twitter users lauding the police's action.

111.title: Missile tests are self-defence actions against US threats: N Korea
111.article_body: North Korea on Saturday said its "missile tests are a normal, planned self-defence measure to protect the country's security and regional peace from direct US military threats". The tests don't harm the safety of neighbouring countries and regions, it added. North Korea has carried out six missile launches in 12 days, including launching an intermediate-range missile over Japan on Tuesday.

112.title: Owner suspects neighbour 'poisoned' dog after dog dies in Gurugram
112.article_body: A case was filed after a man alleged that his neighbour poisoned his pet dog after it died under mysterious circumstances in Gurugram, police said on Friday. The owner claimed that the dog used to stray sometimes and the neighbour had threatened to kill the dog. "I've also handed over a packet of poisonous substance that was recovered," owner added.

113.title: Deepak Chahar ruled out of ODI series against South Africa
113.article_body: Team India fast bowler Deepak Chahar has been ruled out of the ongoing ODI series against South Africa due to stiffness in his back. Earlier, Chahar had missed six months of cricket from February to August due to injuries. All-rounder Washington Sundar, who last played an ODI in February, has been named as Chahar's replacement.

114.title: 50 bricks made of 50.23 kg cocaine worth ₹502 cr seized in Navi Mumbai
114.article_body: Directorate of Revenue Intelligence (DRI) seized 50 bricks made of 50.23 kilograms of cocaine worth ₹502 crore at a Navi Mumbai port. The bricks were inside a container carrying fruits. "This container was brought to India by the same importer...arrested in the case involving the seizure of 198 kilograms of meth and 9 kilograms of cocaine...earlier this week," DRI said.

115.title: Samson, Kishan don't have the X-factor that Pant has: Saba Karim
115.article_body: Ex-selector Saba Karim said Sanju Samson and Ishan Kishan don't have the X-factor that Rishabh Pant possesses. "Pant [is] my first-choice in...white-ball and red-ball cricket," added Karim. "Kishan hasn't made the most of his chances which is why he's fallen down the pecking order...Samson's return to the main team will happen as a batter, not as a wicketkeeper," he stated.

116.title: Tharoor denies rumours claiming he withdrew from Congress President poll
116.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Saturday said that he is "surprised" by calls saying that "rumours from Delhi sources" claimed that he has withdrawn from the party's presidential election. While denying the claims in a video message, he added, "Let me assure you that I don't withdraw from a challenge. Never have all my life and never will."

117.title: Registered labourers in Pune to get ₹4.75 lakh under housing scheme: Maha govt
117.article_body: Maharashtra government would provide financial support of ₹4.75 lakh to registered labourers in Pune under housing scheme, Minister of Labour Suresh Khade said. "The...labourers had to undergo...hardships during...pandemic. Considering that, efforts are being made...to provide [them] homes," he said. The District Collector's office has been told to give information about vacant government lands.

118.title: Identified 250 dengue hotspots in Delhi, will begin door-to-door inspections: MCD
118.article_body: The Municipal Corporation of Delhi (MCD) has identified 250 dengue hotspots across the city, where several mosquito breeding sites were found. Special drives, including fogging, sprinkling of larvicides, cleaning of drainage and water bodies etc will be carried out in these areas. The authorities will also carry out door-to-door inspections to check and destroy mosquito breeding sites.

119.title: Flipkart delivery man runs away with 61 gadgets worth ₹4 lakh in B'luru
119.article_body: A Flipkart delivery executive has been booked for allegedly running away with 61 gadgets including iPhones and laptops in Bengaluru last month. The accused, Shaik Babajan, had to deliver the gadgets worth ₹4 lakh in Ganganagar. The operational manager of a logistics company attached to Flipkart said Babajan had been recruited recently. Police have launched a manhunt to catch him.

120.title: US school district suspends entire police force over May shooting that killed 21
120.article_body: The school district in Uvalde, located in the US state of Texas, has suspended its entire police force on Friday, five months after 19 children and two teachers were killed in a mass shooting. "Recent developments have uncovered additional concerns with department operations," a statement mentioned. Two members of the district police department have been placed on administrative leave.

121.title: US limits sale of chip technology to China with new export rules
121.article_body: The US on Friday announced new export controls limiting the sale of semiconductor technology to China with an aim to cripple Beijing's ability to access critical technologies. Alan Estevez, the Under Secretary of Commerce for Industry and Security, said the Commerce Department was working to prevent China's military, intelligence and security services from accessing sensitive technologies.

122.title: 5-6 men gangrape 23-year-old woman in Haryana, shoot her in the leg
122.article_body: Around five to six men allegedly gangraped a 23-year-old woman in Haryana's Rohtak. As per the police, one of the men took the woman to his office on the pretext of giving her a job and raped her along with his accomplices. "When she resisted, they shot at her in the leg," the police said. The woman is currently hospitalised.

123.title: Big game? Not really: India coach Ramesh Powar on match vs Pakistan
123.article_body: India Women head coach Ramesh Powar said they did not consider the Asia Cup T20 2022 match against Pakistan, where India suffered a defeat by 13 runs, as a "big game". "Otherwise, we wouldn't have tried different things...We didn't want our regular chasers to come in...[We wished to] try out someone younger who can take that role up," added Powar.

124.title: Don't understand why Kejriwal & his gang hate Hindu, Hindutva: Kiren Rijiju
124.article_body: Law Minister Kiren Rijiju criticised AAP and said that he doesn't understand why Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and his gang hate Hindu and Hindutva so much. His remarks came after a video went viral showing Delhi Social Welfare Minister Rajendra Pal Gautam taking part in an event where hundreds took a pledge to convert to Buddhism while denouncing Hindu deities.

125.title: 24-yr-old UP man kills 18-yr-old ex girlfriend, her father after break up
125.article_body: A 24-year-old man killed his 18-year-old former girlfriend and her father after a recent break-up with the woman in Uttar Pradesh. The accused killed them while they were sleeping. The woman's mother was also injured in the attack. The incident took place on Thursday, following which, an FIR was registered against the accused.

126.title: Indian-American envoy tears up during swearing-in administered by US VP
126.article_body: US Vice President Kamala Harris on Friday administered the swearing-in of Indian-American Shefali Razdan Duggal, who was appointed as America's next Ambassador to the Netherlands. Duggal, who had served as a member of the National Finance Committee of Joe Biden for President 2020, was seen tearing up during the ceremony. "We wish you well in this new role," Harris tweeted.

127.title: Nitish Kumar rejects Prashant Kishor's claim of offering him post in Bihar
127.article_body: Bihar Chief Minister Nitish Kumar rejected political strategist Prashant Kishor’s claim of offering him a post recently and said that Kishor is working with the BJP. "It's false. Let him speak whatever he wants, we've nothing to do with it. Four to five years back, he had asked me to merge with the Congress," said Kumar.

128.title: It's not like I'm buying a yacht & can't afford it: Elon Musk on Twitter deal
128.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk told Financial Times he is not buying Twitter in a $44-billion deal for the money. He said, "It's not like I'm trying to buy some yacht and I can't afford it." Explaining the reason behind taking the social media company private, Musk reiterated the importance of a "maximally trusted and inclusive means of exchanging ideas".

129.title: Can't think negative if we want to be champions: Yuvraj on Bumrah's injury
129.article_body: Talking about the reactions to Jasprit Bumrah being ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022, ex-India all-rounder Yuvraj Singh said, "Are we dreaming of becoming champions? Then, we should not allow any negative thinking." "The batters will have to...deliver," added Yuvraj. "Team India got a wake-up call in...Asia Cup 2022...My gut feeling is that they will do well," he stated.

130.title: TMC files complaint with NHRC over public flogging of men in Gujarat
130.article_body: The TMC has filed a complaint with the National Human Rights Commission (NHRC) over the public flogging of Muslim men reportedly by police in Gujarat's Kheda. The men were accused of pelting stones during a garba event. TMC spokesperson Saket Gokhale said it was a matter of shame that the NHRC didn't take a suo moto note of the incident.

131.title: France tells its citizens in Iran to leave 'as soon as possible'
131.article_body: France has urged its citizens in Iran to leave "as soon as possible", citing the risk of arbitrary detention and unfair trial. "The capacity of the French embassy...to provide consular protection to nationals arrested...in Iran is...limited," the French Foreign Ministry said. This step comes after Iranian media had broadcast "confessions" of two French nationals held on espionage charges.

132.title: Kuldeep Bishnoi's son in BJP list for Assembly bypolls in 3 states
132.article_body: The BJP on Saturday announced its candidates for the upcoming Assembly bypolls in Haryana, Telangana and Uttar Pradesh. Bhavya Bishnoi, son of senior BJP leader and former Congress MLA Kuldeep Bishnoi, has been fielded from the Adampur seat in Haryana. K Rajgopal Reddy will fight for Munugode seat in Telangana, while Aman Giri will contest from Gola Gokrannath in UP.

133.title: H'yana man stabs friend to death for asking him to give up drugs
133.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested on Friday after he allegedly stabbed his friend to death in Haryana's Ambala after the latter asked him to give up his drug addiction. The deceased's brother claimed that the accused ran away with the weapon after stabbing his brother in the stomach. The accused was "good friends" with the deceased, the brother also claimed.

134.title: Pune man cheated of ₹2.89 lakh while booking hotel room online
134.article_body: Pune City Police recovered ₹2.89 lakh from an online fraudster who cheated a private company's chief manager while the latter was booking a hotel room online. After booking, he contacted the person on a number he got online. It was the mobile phone number of the accused who took the credit card details and OTP from the man, police said.

135.title: Expeditiously hear Yes Bank's Dish TV EGM plea: Bombay HC to NCLT
135.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the National Company Law Tribunal (NCLT) to expeditiously hear Yes Bank's application, asking the tribunal to order Dish TV to convene an extraordinary general meeting (EGM). The Mumbai bench of NCLT will hear the petition filed by Yes Bank and others on November 3. Yes Bank is the largest shareholder in Dish TV.

136.title: 6 liquor, tobacco brands get notices over surrogate ads: Report
136.article_body: The Consumer Affairs Ministry's Central Consumer Protection Authority (CCPA) has reportedly issued notices to six alcohol and tobacco brands over surrogate advertising. 8 PM Premium Black, Sterling Reserve, Seagram's Imperial Blue, Rajnigandha Pan Masala, Vimal Pan Masala and Kamla Pasand Pan Masala have been asked to respond to notices for violating the advertising guidelines in a month's time.

137.title: New York hospitals to pay $165 mn to women abused by gynaecologist
137.article_body: Two New York hospitals have agreed to pay over $165 million to 147 patients who accused an ex-gynaecologist of sexual abuse and misconduct. Last year, the hospitals, Columbia University Irving Medical Center and NewYork-Presbyterian, reached a $71 million settlement with 79 of Robert Hadden's ex-patients. Hadden surrendered his medical licence after being convicted on sex-related charges in 2016.

138.title: Brickwork Ratings plans legal action after SEBI orders shut down
138.article_body: Brickwork Ratings, which was asked by the Securities and Exchange Board of India (SEBI) to wind up operations within six months, called the latter's action "shocking". The company said it is considering legal recourses. SEBI instructed it to not take on fresh clients or new mandates for "failure to exercise proper skill, care and diligence...duties as a credit rating agency".

139.title: CCI orders probe into Google's alleged unfair news aggregation practice
139.article_body: The Competition Commission of India (CCI) has ordered another probe into Google's alleged unfair revenue sharing practices with respect to news content. The News Broadcasters & Digital Association filed a complaint alleging that its members are forced to provide news content to Google to prioritise their weblinks in the Search Engine Result Page (SERP), without getting adequate compensation.

140.title: Speeding car hits bike in MP, throws biker up in air before hitting pole
140.article_body: A speeding car hit a bike carrying three people in Madhya Pradesh's Jabalpur. The impact of the hit caused one of the bike-borne people to jump up in the air and hit the ground a few metres away. The car also hit a nearby pole after hitting the bike, reports said. The incident reportedly took place on Thursday.

141.title: Huge explosion on bridge linking Russia with Crimea; 7 oil tankers on fire
141.article_body: A fire sparked by a truck bomb has broken out on a key road and rail bridge linking Russia to Crimea. "A truck bomb exploded, setting fire to seven oil tankers being carried by rail to Crimea," Russian news agencies said. Russian President Vladimir Putin unveiled the bridge in 2018, after Crimea was annexed from Ukraine in 2014.

142.title: Was told not to hire Indian-origin people, working mothers: Infosys ex-VP in US lawsuit
142.article_body: A former VP of Recruiting at Infosys has sued the IT major in US accusing it of age and gender bias in its hiring practices. Jill Prejean said she was directed not to hire consultants of Indian-origin, women with children at home, and candidates approaching 50 years of age. Prejean had objected to these practices, but her job was terminated.

143.title: She used to beat me a lot, a ruler got broken on me once: Shweta on Jaya Bachchan
143.article_body: Shweta Bachchan, who has joined her daughter Navya Nanda and mother Jaya Bachchan for the podcast 'What The Hell Navya', said that her mother Jaya used to beat her a lot. "She was very free with her slaps...The ruler got broken on me once," Shweta said. "Abhishek hardly got slapped. I believe always the first child gets thrashed," Jaya replied.

144.title: Rizwan shouldn't listen to anyone: Afridi on criticism over strike rate
144.article_body: Shahid Afridi said Muhammad Rizwan shouldn't "listen to anyone", following criticism over his strike rate. Ex-Pakistan bowler Sikander Bakht criticised Rizwan's knock in a T20I against Bangladesh. "Shan Masood showed intent...He came in the seventh over...At that time, Rizwan was batting on 28. Shan was dismissed in the 12th over...[for] 31. Rizwan...was [then] batting on 38," he stated.

145.title: E-auction of PM mementoes 2022 extended till October 12
145.article_body: Prime Minister Narendra Modi announced that the PM mementoes 2022 auction has been extended till October 12 this year. "To view the mementoes, visit the National Gallery of Modern Art in New Delhi from 11am - 6pm...The proceeds will be utilised for the Namami Gange project," the Ministry of Culture tweeted.

146.title: Portion of UP's Purvanchal Expressway caves in; 4 people injured
146.article_body: Four people, who were travelling in a car, were injured after a portion of the Purvanchal Expressway in Uttar Pradesh's Sultanpur caved in amid heavy rainfall, officials said. District Magistrate Raveesh Gupta said that most of the repair and maintenance work was completed by Friday morning. The Purvanchal Expressway was inaugurated by PM Narendra Modi in November last year.

147.title: Chile permanently closes mining areas connected to giant sinkhole
147.article_body: Chile's Mining Minister Marcela Hernando on Friday announced the permanent closure of mining stopes directly related to a giant sinkhole that appeared in July. The government is working on recovering water from an aquifer that was damaged by the sinkhole, she added. On Thursday, Chile's environmental regulator announced charges against the Canadian-owned Lundin Mining Corporation for the sinkhole.

148.title: Man rapes 16-yr-old lover, puts her in bag & throws in Assam forest; she walks back home
148.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested in Assam's Cachar district for allegedly kidnapping, raping and attempting to kill a 16-year-old girl. Her family said the accused tried to slit her throat, packed her in a bag and dumped it in a forest, however, she freed herself and walked back home. Police said the girl was in a relationship with the accused.

149.title: How does the RBI plan to introduce Digital Rupee or 'e₹' in India?
149.article_body: The RBI has released a concept note on central bank digital currency, announcing plans to commence a pilot launch of Digital Rupee or 'e₹' soon. A large-scale pilot will be conducted, with users from different income levels, literacy levels, regions, genders and age groups. The Digital Rupee will be designed in a manner that's least disruptive to existing financial system.

150.title: A producer once gave me a blank cheque, I rejected it: Ayushmann Khurrana
150.article_body: Ayushmann Khurrana has said that a producer once gave him a blank cheque. "The producer said take the money you want, do three films with us. We'll write the scripts later," Ayushmann added. "For me, the script is very important. I don't want to do anything regressive. I know the popular palette is regressive," he further said.

151.title: Mandate singing National Anthem in all MP schools: NCPCR
151.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has asked the Madhya Pradesh government to make singing of the National Anthem mandatory as part of the morning prayers in all schools. This comes after NCPCR chief Priyank Kanoongo visited CM Rise school in Vidisha and found 'mazars' (tombs) on the campus. NCPCR recommended an FIR against the principal.

152.title: Kapiva launches 4-Balance program to manage weight with Get Slim Juice
152.article_body: Kapiva announced that its 4-Balance program is an Ayurvedic way to manage weight by making small lifestyle changes for long-term benefits. It offers Get Slim Juice, free diet plan, yoga and nutritionist consultation, aiming to improve digestion and metabolism. "Combination of 12 herbs boosts metabolism, reduces fat accumulation to reduce weight as claimed by 90% users," Kapiva's Dr Soni said.

153.title: IAF gets new operational branch for the 1st time since Independence
153.article_body: Chief of Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari, on Saturday said that a new weapon system branch has been approved for the Indian Air Force. He added that this was the first time since Independence that a new operational branch has been created in the IAF. The new branch would result in savings of over ₹3,400 crore.

154.title: Tipu Express between Bengaluru & Mysuru renamed as Wodeyar Express
154.article_body: The Railway Board changed the name of the train connecting Bengaluru and Mysuru from Tipu Express to Wodeyar Express. The change in name comes months after Mysuru MP Pratap Simha met Railway Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw in February and made the request. The board also renamed the express train between Mysuru and Talaguppe in honour of the poet Kuvempu.

155.title: Jharkhand records India's highest percentage of child marriages among girls
155.article_body: Jharkhand recorded the highest percentage of child marriages among girls, according to a Ministry of Home Affairs survey. "The percentage of females who got married before reaching 18 years of age is 1.9 at the national level...varies from 0.0 in Kerala to 5.8 in Jharkhand," the survey stated. Child marriages accounted for 7.3% of marriages in rural areas in Jharkhand.

156.title: People supported me because of my character, that was unexpected: Federer
156.article_body: Twenty-time Grand Slam champion Roger Federer said he was surprised by the messages which he received from a lot of people because of his character, following his retirement, terming it "unexpected". "I thought they [will]...talk about...[my] achievements...It was much more than that. It totally over-exceeded my expectations," added Federer. "People will get a chance to see me again," he stated.

157.title: Chhattisgarh Class 10, 12 toppers get helicopter ride as CM promised
157.article_body: Toppers of Class 10 and Class 12 exams in Chhattisgarh were taken on a helicopter ride by the state government on Saturday. CM Bhupesh Baghel had promised this in May. "We felt really good. It was for the first time that we had a helicopter ride. Other students will also be encouraged to perform well in their studies," said students.

158.title: UK PM Truss fires Trade Min over allegations of serious misconduct
158.article_body: UK PM Liz Truss has fired Trade Minister Conor Burns following allegations of serious misconduct. The Conservative whips' office said Burns has also been suspended from the party's group in Parliament pending an investigation into claims of inappropriate behaviour during the party conference earlier this week. "I'll fully cooperate with...enquiry and look forward to clearing my name," Burns said.

159.title: Mulayam Singh remains critical, put on life-saving drugs: Medanta Hospital
159.article_body: The Medanta Hospital has confirmed that former UP CM Mulayam Singh Yadav's condition is still critical and that he is on life-saving drugs. He has been undergoing treatment for a kidney infection since August 22. Earlier, PM Modi had spoken to SP chief, Akhilesh Yadav, to enquire about Mulayam's health. He had assured him of all possible help and assistance.

160.title: Mumbai diamond company employee steals 19 diamonds worth ₹12 lakh, booked
160.article_body: A diamond polishing and designing unit employee in Mumbai has been booked after he allegedly stole 19 diamonds worth ₹12 lakh after being asked to work on them. The accused also alleged that his employer had stolen his gold chain. However, reports said that the accused had offered the chain as security till he could arrange the diamonds' amount.

161.title: Give Pakistan credit for beating India which is a billion-dollar cricket industry: Ramiz
161.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) chief Ramiz Raja has said that Pakistan should be given credit for beating India, which is a billion-dollar cricket industry. "India have started giving Pakistan respect as they always perceived Pakistan can't beat them," Ramiz added. Notably, Pakistan defeated India in Super 4 stage of Asia Cup in September.

162.title: Indian Air Force unveils its new combat uniform; pics surface
162.article_body: On its 90th anniversary, the Indian Air Force on Saturday unveiled its new combat uniform. The celebrations, which were held in Chandigarh, featured an air display over the Sukhna Lake. Chief of the Air Staff, Air Chief Marshal VR Chaudhari, said, "We are also planning on induction of women Agniveers starting next year. Creation of infrastructure is in progress."

163.title: Putin gifted pyramids of melons, watermelons by Tajikistan President on his birthday
163.article_body: Tajikistan's President, Emomali Rahmon, gifted pyramids of melons and watermelons to Russian President Vladimir Putin on his 70th birthday. Videos of the pyramids, which were shared by social media users, went viral. Meanwhile, multiple Ukrainian officials took to social media to denounce the Russian leader on his birthday, blaming him for the war's rising death toll.

164.title: Kevin Spacey pressed his groin against me, I felt frozen: Actor Anthony on when he was 14
164.article_body: US actor Anthony Rapp testified in a court that he was sexually assaulted by actor Kevin Spacey when he was 14 in 1986. Rapp alleged he was in Spacey's bedroom during a party when the actor laid him on a bed and pressed his groin against Rapp's body. "I felt that moment was very long. I felt frozen," Rapp added.

165.title: No promotion to Classes 5, 8 students if they fail annual exams: Delhi govt
165.article_body: Classes 5 and 8 students will not be promoted if they fail to clear annual examinations as per the Delhi government's new promotion policy. The 'no detention policy' was progressive but the education system could not take its full advantage due to lack of preparation, Manish Sisodia said. The new guidelines will be implemented from the academic session 2023-24.

166.title: Crypto investment startup xalts raises $6 million in funding round
166.article_body: Crypto investment management startup xalts has secured $6 million in a funding round. The round saw participation from Accel, Citi Ventures, Polygon Co-founder Sandeep Nailwal, and other hedge fund managers. The company was co-founded in 2022 by former HSBC trader Ashutosh Goel and former Meta Asia executive Supreet Kaur.

167.title: RattanIndia buys Micromax Co-founder Rahul Sharma's Revolt Motors
167.article_body: RattanIndia Enterprises has acquired Micromax Co-founder Rahul Sharma's electric vehicle (EV) manufacturer Revolt Motors for an undisclosed amount. Earlier, the company acquired a 33.8% stake in the EV startup and had an option of increasing its shareholding. Revolt Motors has a manufacturing facility in Haryana and 29 dealerships across the country.

168.title: Pune development authority buys drones to check encroachments
168.article_body: Pune Metropolitan Region Development Authority (PMRDA) has bought two drones to facilitate its projects and check on encroachments, a PMRDA officer said. With this, PMRDA has become "the only government agency" in Maharashtra to own a drone, the officer claimed. "Drones will help get high-resolution images of areas that can be...developed into 3D images for our projects," the officer added.

169.title: Gurugram man flogs child for 'playing on heap of construction sand'
169.article_body: A case was filed after a man allegedly flogged an eight-year-old child with a stick in Gurugram's Bhondsi for "playing on a heap of sand kept for construction work" and then assaulted his neighbour who came to rescue the child, police said on Friday. The accused apparently beat several children but the child was the one who was badly beaten.

170.title: 'Varna', caste a thing of the past, should be discarded: RSS chief
170.article_body: RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat on Friday said that the concepts of 'varna' and 'jaati' (caste) are a thing of the past and should be completely discarded. If today someone asks about these institutions, the answer should be that "it is past, let's forget it", he said. Bhagwat was addressing at a book launch event in Nagpur.

171.title: Tesla CEO Elon Musk offers proposal to resolve China-Taiwan issues
171.article_body: After floating a possible deal to end the Russia-Ukraine war, Tesla CEO Elon Musk has now suggested recommendations to end tensions between China and Taiwan. "Figure out a special administrative zone for Taiwan that is reasonably palatable...probably won't make everyone happy," Musk said. Notably, Tesla's electric car plant in Shanghai accounted for about half of its global deliveries last year.

172.title: India’s forex reserves record lowest level since July 2020
172.article_body: India's foreign exchange reserves fell by $4.854 billion to $532.66 billion for the week ended September 30, Reserve Bank of India data showed. This is the ninth straight weekly drop and the lowest since July 24, 2020. The decline was due to a dip in foreign currency assets which decreased to $472.81 billion from $477.21 in the previous week.

173.title: Heroin worth ₹360 crore seized from Pakistani boat off Gujarat coast
173.article_body: In a joint operation, the Indian Coast Guard and the Gujarat Anti-Terrorism Squad (ATS) seized 50 kg heroin worth ₹360 crore from a Pakistani boat off the state's coast, said an official. Six crew members were present on the Pakistani boat Al Sakar, which is being taken to the Jakhau port for further investigation, added the official.

174.title: Arrested for forgery, man escapes police; runs out of Delhi police station
