174.article_body: A 42-year-old man, who was arrested in a forgery case, managed to escape from police custody in Delhi. He was being taken for a medical examination. The incident took place on Thursday when the accused escaped the grip of the police and ran out of the main gate of the Badarpur Police Station.

175.title: Ukraine has retaken nearly 2,500 sq km in new counteroffensive: Zelenskyy
175.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy on Friday said that Ukrainian forces have recaptured around 2,500 square kilometres of territory from Russian troops in a counteroffensive that began late last month. "This week alone, our soldiers liberated 776 square kilometres of territory in the east of our country and 29 settlements, including six in the Luhansk region," he added.

176.title: List of areas to see power cuts in Bengaluru this weekend released
176.article_body: Parts of Bengaluru will see power cuts on Saturday and Sunday, mostly between 10 am and 4 pm, owing to maintenance work by BESCOM. On Saturday, areas including Billekempanahalli, Maruthinagara, Beemenahalli, Ningaianadoddi, Rangegowdanadoddi and Lakshmisagara under Ramanagara division will be affected. On Sunday, Karnataka Industrial Areas Development Board (KIADB) first phase will be impacted.

177.title: Russia takes control of office of 2022 Nobel Peace Prize-winning organisation
177.article_body: A Russian court on Friday ordered the seizure of 2022 Nobel Peace Prize-winning human rights organisation Memorial's office. The court ordered that the organisation's Moscow office "become state property". Memorial won the Nobel Peace Prize along with Belarusian human rights activist Ales Bialiatski and Ukrainian human rights organisation Center for Civil Liberties.

178.title: Man sacrifices 7-yr-old son to 'gain black magic spells' in Bihar
178.article_body: A man was arrested after he allegedly sacrificed his seven-year-old son to "gain black magic spells" in Bihar, an official said on Friday. The accused, who practises witchcraft, strangled his son to death on the night of Vijaya Dashmi, according to reports. "After committing...crime, [the accused] was hiding behind...bushes which are located some distance away from his house," SHO said.

179.title: Gave other batters a chance, backfired: Harmanpreet on India's loss vs Pak
179.article_body: Reacting to India's first loss in more than six years against Pakistan in women's international cricket, India captain Harmanpreet Kaur said, "We were trying to give other batters a chance...It backfired." "It was...chaseable...We were not able to...rotate the strike. We played too many dot balls," added Harmanpreet. Pakistan beat India by 13 runs in an Asia Cup T20 2022 match.

180.title: TN Guv approves bill to ban online gambling, regulate online gaming
180.article_body: Tamil Nadu Governor RN Ravi has promulgated an ordinance to ban online gambling and regulate online gaming in the state. As per the notification, online games providers "shall not provide any online gaming service or allow playing of any online game of chance...with money or other stakes". Last month, the state government approved an ordinance to ban online gambling.

181.title: It's completely man-made massacre: BJP MLA on Jalpaiguri flash flood mishap
181.article_body: BJP Falakata MLA Dipak Barman said that the Jalpaiguri flash flood incident that claimed the lives of at least eight people on October 5 was a "man-made massacre". "The norms have been violated and silt has been excavated from near the pillars of the railway bridge on the river. We will submit our report to the central leaders," said Barman.

182.title: List of world's highest-paid football players released; 23-year-old Mbappé ranks 1st
182.article_body: Paris Saint-Germain player Kylian Mbappé has ranked first on the list of the world's highest-paid football players, with Forbes estimating the 23-year-old will earn $128 million for the 2022-23 season. He's followed by Lionel Messi and Cristiano Ronaldo, expected to rake in $120 million and $100 million, respectively, this season. The list includes Neymar Jr, Mohamed Salah and Erling Haaland.

183.title: Headcount management startup TeamOhana raises $4 mn in seed round
183.article_body: Headcount management company TeamOhana has secured $4 million in a seed funding round led by Sierra Ventures, with participation from Katalyst Ventures. The funding round saw participation from angel investors and strategic operators, including Notion COO Akshay Kothari, Aurora Solar Co-founder Samuel Adeyemo. The startup was co-founded in 2021 by Tushar Makhija and Baishampayan Ghose.

184.title: US man killed after GPS directs him to bridge that wasn't there
184.article_body: A 47-year-old man in US was killed after the GPS directed him to a bridge that wasn't there. Phil Paxson was heading home after his daughter's ninth birthday when his Jeep fell into a river after the GPS guided him to a bridge that was destroyed in 2013. Reports said there were no barriers or warning signs for the drivers.

185.title: Shoppers Stop signs Yami Gautam for its ‘Nayi Diwali Nayi Soch’ campaign
185.article_body: This festive season, Shoppers Stop aims to celebrate the joy of gifting by breaking away from clichés and choosing to dismiss stereotypes. With a new perspective towards Diwali, it wants consumers to embrace a fresh soch (thought), making it a Diwali to remember, adding that #NayiDiwaliNayiSoch is a stepping stone towards making old bonds stronger with new traditions.

186.title: India reports 2,797 new COVID-19 cases, active cases stand at 29,251
186.article_body: India reported 2,797 new COVID-19 cases in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. This comes a day after the country recorded 1,997 new COVID-19 cases. The active cases in India now stand at 29,251 following 3,884 recoveries in the last 24 hours. The daily positivity rate currently stands at 1.05%.

187.title: Boat carrying heroin worth ₹1,200 cr intercepted off Kerala's coast
187.article_body: The Indian Navy and the Narcotics Control Bureau (NCB), in a coordinated operation, have intercepted a boat carrying 200 kg of heroin worth about ₹1,200 crore off the coast of Kerala's Kochi. NCB Deputy Director General (Operations) SK Singh said that boat has been seized and its six Iranian crew members were arrested under the NDPS Act.

188.title: Panacea Biotech Founder & Chairman Soshil Kumar Jain dies at 89
188.article_body: Panacea Biotec Limited Founder and Chairman Soshil Kumar Jain passed away on Friday. Jain, 89, had been hospitalised for the past 10 days and suffered a cardiac arrest on Friday. Jain founded the company in 1984 as Panacea Drugs Private Limited. Its name was changed to Panacea Biotec when it was publicly listed on the stock exchanges in September 1995.

189.title: Punjab government regularises services of 8,736 contractual teachers
189.article_body: A notification for regularisation of services of 8,736 contractual teachers in Punjab has been issued, CM Bhagwant Mann said. "CM urged teachers to discharge their duties well for grooming students," CM's office tweeted. This comes a month after Punjab Cabinet gave a nod over the policy framed for regularising services of contractual teachers who have completed 10 years of service.

190.title: TSRTC starts new bus service from Hyderabad to Ananthagiri Hills
190.article_body: The Telangana State Road Transport Corporation (TSRTC) has started a new bus service from Hyderabad to Ananthagiri Hills in the Vikarabad district for tourists. The special bus departs at 8 am from KPHB and arrives in Ananthagiri Hills around 10 am. The return trip starts at 4 pm from Ananthagiri Hills and drops tourists in Hyderabad at about 7 pm.

191.title: Eva Mendes responds after reports claim she quit acting, says 'wanted to be with my babies'
191.article_body: Eva Mendes has responded after reports claimed that she quit acting. Taking to Instagram, she wrote, "I never quit acting. I wanted to be home with my babies and fortunately my other business ventures allowed me to do that more than acting would." "Also, I wasn't excited about the stereotypical roles being offered to me at the time," she added.

192.title: PhysicsWallah CEO's Instagram account disabled, says 'request to reinstate taking ages'
192.article_body: Edtech unicorn PhysicsWallah's Founder-CEO Alakh Pandey said his Instagram account has been disabled "for pretending to be someone else". Criticising Instagram-parent Meta in a LinkedIn post, Pandey wrote, "We have tried contacting several people in the global operations team...but...a simple request to reinstate my account is taking ages." He asked Meta to "connect a responsible person" with him.

193.title: Congress workers detained for wearing 'PayCM' t-shirts in Karnataka
193.article_body: Karnataka Police have detained a few Congress workers for wearing t-shirts with "PayCM" printed on them during the party’s Bharat Jodo Yatra. "PayCM" is an aggressive campaign launched by Congress against the Bommai government, accusing it of massive corruption. Earlier this month, a Congress worker was made to take off his t-shirt that featured the "PayCM" poster.

194.title: Trump would've averted Ukraine war if he was still US Prez: Bolsonaro
194.article_body: Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro said the war in Ukraine wouldn't have happened if Donald Trump was still US President. However, he offered no explanation for how his close ally could've prevented the conflict. Ahead of the first round of Brazil's Presidential election on October 2, Trump had endorsed Bolsonaro, saying he was "one of the great Presidents...in the world".

195.title: 13-yr-old Punjab boy goes missing after cycling 250km to meet Delhi YouTuber, found later
195.article_body: A 13-year-old boy from Punjab's Patiala cycled over 250 km to Delhi to meet YouTuber Nischay Malhan, also known as 'Triggered Insaan'. The boy was reported missing by his family, following which a police search was launched. Nischay, who is currently in Dubai, confirmed on Twitter the boy has been found, adding, "He's now with his family, safe and secure."

196.title: Police book 3 for shooting a man in Gurugram's Arjun Nagar
196.article_body: Haryana Police have booked three people for allegedly shooting at a man in Gurugram's Arjun Nagar on Thursday night. "Doctors told us that he sustained five bullet injuries and that a few of his internal organs were damaged," said the victim's father. All the three accused are on the run and the motive behind the attack is still unclear.

197.title: India will buy oil from wherever it has to: Govt on imports from Russia amid Ukraine war
197.article_body: Commenting on India buying oil from Russia amid the war in Ukraine, Union Minister of Petroleum and Natural Gas Hardeep Singh Puri said, "India will buy oil from wherever it has to," adding that the government has a moral duty to provide energy to people. Puri further said India hasn't been told by anyone to stop buying oil from Russia.

198.title: 57-yr-old saved as live heart transported via green channel in Hyd
198.article_body: A 57-year-old patient with heart failure underwent a successful transplant after a live heart was transported via a green channel created from Yashoda Hospital in Secunderabad to Nizam's Institute of Medical Sciences, Punjagutta. The organ belonged to a road accident victim, 28, who was declared brain-dead at Yashoda Hospital. The traffic police helped provide a traffic-free stretch of road.

199.title: Parts of Mumbai face waterlogging due to heavy rains, yellow alert issued
199.article_body: Several parts of Mumbai faced waterlogging after heavy rains lashed the city on Saturday morning. News agency ANI shared visuals from Sion and Hindmata areas of the city, where waterlogging has taken place. Meanwhile, the India Meteorological Department has issued a yellow alert for Mumbai for Saturday and has said gusty winds and thunderstorms are expected.

200.title: List of 400 apps that may have stolen 10 lakh Facebook usernames, passwords released
200.article_body: Meta has shared a list of 400 Android and iOS apps that were specifically designed to steal Facebook users' login credentials. The apps were disguised as photo editors, games, VPN services, business apps and other utilities to trick people into downloading them. Facebook said it will notify roughly 1 million users that their usernames and passwords may have been compromised.

201.title: Man attacks 14 women wearing saree & bindi, rips their jewellery in US
201.article_body: A 37-year-old man named Lathan Johnson has been charged with hate crimes and robberies in US' California after he attacked at least 14 South Asian women and tore necklaces worth $35,000 off their necks, a district attorney office stated. It added that the suspect attacked women who ranged in age from 50-73 and wore saree, bindi and other ethnic attire.

202.title: Ex-Pune Bar Association head booked in ₹1.35 crore cheating case
202.article_body: A case has been filed against former Pune Bar Association head Satish Mulik and three others in connection with a ₹1.35 crore cheating case. The complainant claimed that Mulik signed an agreement for the sale of land but refused to give the money after the complainant left it at Mulik's residence as it was late at night.

203.title: Sex racket busted at spa centre in Pune, 4 foreign women rescued
203.article_body: Pune City Police has busted a sex racket operating at a spa centre in the Koregaon Park area and rescued four foreign women. Among those rescued, three women are from Thailand and one from Nepal, police said. Police acted on a tip-off and also nabbed two men who were allegedly running a prostitution racket at the centre.

204.title: Constable arrested for stealing ₹10 lakh from businessman in B'luru
204.article_body: A police constable has been arrested for allegedly stealing ₹10 lakh from a businessman in Bengaluru. The accused had found ₹50 lakh cash in the businessman's car while patrolling in the Chandra Layout area. He seized the vehicle and sent the victim to the police station. He took ₹10 lakh out of the total amount and sent to his wife.

205.title: Omar Abdullah falls while playing football in Srinagar school, shares video
205.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir National Conference Vice President Omar Abdullah took to social media to share videos of himself playing football with other people in a school in Srinagar. He also fell to the ground in one video. "Took a tumble, dusted myself off...I didn't score, though that wasn't for want of trying. There's always next time," he wrote.

206.title: Canada to deny entry to more than 10,000 members of Iran's IRGC
206.article_body: Canada said it'd ban the top 50% of Iran's Islamic Revolutionary Guard Corps (IRGC) leadership and over 10,000 officers and senior members from entering the country. This comes amid an ongoing "brutal" crackdown on mass protests in Iran over Mahsa Amini's death. "This is the strongest measure we've to go after states and state entities," Canadian PM Justin Trudeau said.

207.title: Delhi govt to organise Chhath Puja at 1,100 ghats with ₹25 cr budget
207.article_body: Delhi government will organise Chhath Puja at 1,100 ghats in 2022 and has set aside a budget of ₹25 crore. This comes after Delhi Revenue Minister Kailash Gahlot on Friday held a review meeting. The Revenue Department will ensure tents, lights, chairs, tables, sound systems, CCTV cameras, LED screens and power backup are available at all the sites.

208.title: Suzlon Energy appoints Vinod R Tanti as CMD for 3 years
208.article_body: Suzlon Energy appointed Vinod R Tanti as the Chairman and Managing Director (CMD) with immediate effect for a period of three years. Vinod Tanti is the younger brother of Suzlon Founder Tulsi Tanti, who passed away due to a cardiac arrest last week. Vinod Tanti was earlier the Wholetime Director and COO at Suzlon and has resigned from these posts.

209.title: Delhi man kills father, injures mother for refusing to lend money
209.article_body: A 34-year-old man was arrested on Friday after he allegedly stabbed his 65-year-old father to death and injured his mother in Delhi after they refused to lend him money, police said.The accused had demanded money from his parents after he lost over ₹7 lakh in stock market, police added. The accused's mother is critical, DCP (West) Ghanshyam Bansal said.

210.title: CNG, piped cooking gas prices hiked by ₹3 in Delhi
210.article_body: Prices of CNG and piped cooking gas have been increased by ₹3 each in Delhi. CNG rate has been increased to ₹78.61 per kg from ₹75.61 per kg. Meanwhile, price of Piped Natural Gas (PNG) has been increased to ₹53.59 per standard cubic metre from ₹50.59 per standard cubic metre. Prices have also been raised in Noida and Gurugram.

211.title: Putin gets a tractor as gift from Belarus President on 70th birthday
211.article_body: Russian President Vladimir Putin was gifted a tractor by Belarus President Alexander Lukashenko on his 70th birthday. Putin was given a certificate to say he had been presented with a Belarusian tractor. Lukashenko, who has ruled the ex-Soviet nation for nearly three decades, told reporters he used a model in his garden similar to the one he gifted Putin.

212.title: 11 killed, 38 injured as bus catches fire after it hits truck in Maharashtra's Nashik
212.article_body: At least 11 persons, including a child, were killed and 38 others were injured after a bus caught fire in Maharashtra's Nashik on Saturday morning, officials said. The bus caught fire on Aurangabad road after hitting a truck at around 5.15 am, officials added. "The injured have been shifted to the hospital for treatment," DCP Nashik Amol Tambe said.

213.title: Won't live in a house as part of anti-liquor campaign: Uma Bharti
213.article_body: BJP leader Uma Bharti said she will not stay in a house from November 7, 2022, to January 14, 2023, as part of a campaign against the illegal sale of alcohol in Madhya Pradesh. Bharti said in this period she will live in a hut or a tent. She also praised the state government for starting an anti-liquor campaign.

214.title: 1st phase of Haryana's Panchayat polls to be held on Oct 30 & Nov 2
214.article_body: The first phase of Haryana's Panchayat elections will be held on October 30 and November 2. The ten districts which will go to polls are Bhiwani, Fatehabad, Jhajjar, Jind, Kaithal, Mahendragarh, Nuh, Panchkula, Panipat and Yamunanagar, State Election Commissioner D Singh said on Friday. Polling will start at 7 am and end at 6 pm.

215.title: Developing economies will need to put $1 tn in renewable energy: IMF
215.article_body: The International Monetary Fund (IMF) on Friday said the investment needs of developing countries "solely in renewable energy could reach $1 trillion a year by 2030". The IMF said this funding would ensure the net-zero target of greenhouse gas emissions is achieved by 2050. The IMF said two-thirds of global greenhouse gases are emitted by developing economies and emerging markets.

216.title: We will contest Assembly elections alone: YSR Telangana Party
216.article_body: YSR Telangana Party Founder YS Sharmila on Friday said her outfit will contest the 2023 Assembly polls in Telangana alone in all 119 seats. "We will go solo...we will not ally with the BJP or other parties," Sharmila said in New Delhi. She said the party was formed because there was "misrule" in Telangana.

217.title: Nearly 30,000 use Ahmedabad metro on 1st day after 2 corridors opened
217.article_body: As many as 29,877 passengers rode the Ahmedabad metro on the first day of both of its corridors operating. The North-West corridor, which was opened for the public's use on October 6, connects APMC Vasna to Motera. The Gujarat Metro Rail Corporation said over 10,000 passengers used the metro on the North-West corridor on Thursday.

218.title: Nawaz Sharif's daughter meets him in UK after travel ban lifted
218.article_body: Former Pakistani Prime Minister Nawaz Sharif met his daughter Maryam Nawaz Sharif in London on Friday. Maryam, whose travel ban was removed recently, surrendered her passport to a Pakistani court in 2019 to get bail in a case. Nawaz has been sentenced to 10 years in prison in a property case. He is in the UK for medical treatment.

219.title: Delhi logs 101 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
219.article_body: Delhi reported 101 fresh cases of COVID-19 with a positivity rate of 1.38% in the last 24 hours, the city health department informed on Friday. One death due to the infection was also recorded. The city's active case count stood at 366. Moreover, Delhi witnessed a rise in new cases as 57 COVID-19 cases were logged on the previous day.

220.title: Pakistan's middle order is not performing at all: Inzamam-ul-Haq
220.article_body: Former Pakistan skipper Inzamam-ul-Haq said that the side's middle order has not been performing and openers, Babar Azam and Muhammad Rizwan, have taken all the responsibility on themselves. "Pakistan bowlers are performing in the absence of Shaheen Afridi...We can win the tournament if the batting unit kicks in because we have a good bowling attack," the 52-year-old former batter said.

221.title: We are not favourites at WC, there are other teams above us: Messi
221.article_body: Argentina skipper Lionel Messi said that "anything can happen" in the upcoming FIFA World Cup and "favourites don't always" win. "Argentina is always a candidate because of its history," Messi said. He added, "Now even more so because of the moment we're in, but we are not the favourites. I think there are other teams that are above us."

222.title: Why can't a 75-yr-old man have fun: Digvijaya Singh on his dance video
222.article_body: Senior Congress leader Digvijaya Singh danced during the Bharat Jodo Yatra in Karnataka on Friday. Sharing a video of his dance, he tweeted, "Why can't a 75-year-old young man have fun!!" He mentioned that ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah, who is also 75, ran with Congress leader Rahul Gandhi on Thursday. "For men, you are as old as you feel," he tweeted.

223.title: Pakistan are over-dependent on Babar, Rizwan: Sanjay Bangar
223.article_body: Ahead of the India-Pakistan match at the T20 World Cup on October 23, ex-cricketer Sanjay Bangar has commented on the composition of both sides. "It's clear that Pakistan [are] over-dependent on their top order like Babar (Azam) and (Muhammad) Rizwan. Whereas the Indian team is not actually dependent [only] on a couple of players," Bangar said.

224.title: Kyrgios retires ahead of Japan Open quarter-finals due to knee injury
224.article_body: Australian tennis star Nick Kyrgios pulled out of the Japan Open minutes before the quarter-finals with a sore left knee. "I actually was dealing with a bit of a knee issue around the US Open time...It's heartbreaking. When the body lets you down, it's not a good feeling," said Kyrgios. He was scheduled to play against third-seeded American Taylor Fritz.

225.title: I wouldn't have made 'Adipurush' without Prabhas: Om Raut
225.article_body: Filmmaker Om Raut said he wouldn't have made 'Adipurush' without Prabhas. "I always had Prabhas in my mind when I was writing Raghav's character. It became so compelling for me. The way he has played it is divine," Raut said. Ever since the film's teaser, which is based on Ramayana released, the makers have been accused of misrepresenting the characters.

226.title: West Bengal logs 150 fresh COVID-19 cases, 1 death
226.article_body: West Bengal reported 150 new cases of COVID-19 and one death due to the infection in the last 24 hours, the health department informed on Friday. The state's active case count stood at 2,026. A daily positivity rate of 2.81% was recorded. West Bengal witnessed a surge in new cases as 69 cases were logged on the previous day.

227.title: Deepak Chahar better skilled bowler than Bhuvneshwar: Harbhajan
227.article_body: Former India spinner Harbhajan Singh said all-rounder Deepak Chahar is a better fast bowler than Bhuvneshwar Kumar. "Deepak Chahar is the only bowler who can get the ball to swing up-front and both ways and looks like getting 2-3 wickets in Powerplay," said Harbhajan. He added that Chahar is, in the "present scenario", a "better-skilled bowler" than Bhuvneshwar.

228.title: Would have been 2021 world champion with extra $300,000: Hamilton
228.article_body: Mercedes F1 driver Lewis Hamilton said if the team had money left over in its 2021 budget then he would have been world champion. "If we had spent $300,000...it would have changed the outcome," said Hamilton, who lost the championship to Red Bull F1's Max Verstappen. Recent reports claim that Red Bull had exceeded their 2021 budget cap.

229.title: How does the Cricket World Cup Super League table read after India's defeat?
229.article_body: After defeating India in the first ODI in Lucknow, South Africa gained 10 points and have aggregated a total of 59 points in the Cricket World Cup Super League. They are currently 11th on the points table, which is led by England with 125 points. Top-seven ranked teams and World Cup hosts (India) will automatically qualify for 2023 World Cup.

230.title: Indian-origin teenager stabbed to death in Israel less than a year after immigrating
230.article_body: An Indian-origin 18-year-old was stabbed to death in Israel, less than a year after he immigrated there. Yoel Lehingahel was killed after a brawl involving over 20 teens broke out at a birthday party in Kiryat Shmona, reports said. A 15-year-old was arrested and seven others, between the ages of 13 and 15, were detained over the incident.

231.title: Govt and LIC together to divest 60.72% stake in IDBI Bank
231.article_body: The Department of Investment and Public Asset Management on Friday invited expressions of interest (EoIs) from potential bidders for strategic divestment of specified government and LIC stakes in IDBI Bank along with transfer of management control. The government and LIC will together divest a 60.72% stake in the lender. Centre will divest a 30.48% stake while LIC will offload 30.24%.

232.title: Don't want to retire at all, will come back from injury: Mary Kom
232.article_body: India boxer MC Mary Kom said she does not want to "retire at all" and will surely make a comeback from her injury. "I want to make a comeback, I have got that guts. Why shouldn't I make a comeback," said Kom. The Olympics bronze medallist added that she wants "to do something for the country again" before retiring.

233.title: 3 children, aged 8-10, drown in pond in UP's Lalitpur
233.article_body: Three children drowned in a pond in Agoura village in Lalitpur, Uttar Pradesh on Friday. The deceased were identified as Chandrapratap Singh (8), his brother Surat Singh (10), and Amit (10), Superintendent of Police (Lalitpur) Gopal Krishan Choudhary said. Notably, the bodies were recovered from the pond and sent for post-mortem, Choudhary added.

234.title: CM announces ₹10 lakh compensation after J'khand woman burnt alive
234.article_body: Jharkhand CM Hemant Soren on Friday condoled the demise of a 22-year-old woman who was burnt alive by a man in Dumka for allegedly rejecting his marriage proposal. The CM announced a compensation of ₹10 lakh for her family. The accused allegedly set the woman ablaze after pouring petrol on her when she was asleep. He's currently in police custody.

235.title: 2 youths set off fireworks & obstruct traffic on NH-9 in Ghaziabad, arrested
235.article_body: Two youths were arrested on Friday after they allegedly obstructed traffic by sitting on the roof of a car and setting off fireworks in Uttar Pradesh's Ghaziabad. The incident reportedly took place on the NH-9 in the Vijay Nagar police station limits on Thursday. One of the vehicles seen in a video of the incident has been seized, police said.

236.title: Sajid Khan has right to live, don't do drama of quitting B'wood: Payal to Mandana
236.article_body: After Mandana Karimi said she doesn't want to work in Bollywood while talking about #MeToo accused Sajid Khan bagging 'Bigg Boss 16', Payal Rohatgi reacted. "Sajid...has...right to live [and] earn money...You oppose him but don't do...drama of quitting Bollywood," she wrote on Instagram Stories. Mandana earlier alleged that Sajid once asked her to remove clothes during a meeting.

237.title: Told wife 'If Zwigato doesn't work, I will not lose anything': Kapil Sharma
237.article_body: Comedian-actor Kapil Sharma, speaking about his upcoming film 'Zwigato', said, "I told my wife, if [it] doesn't work, I'll not lose anything. But if it succeeds...then I'll get a lot from it." "Comedy shows are my bread and butter. Because of that...I was motivated to look for something else...I thought the kitchen is safe, let's experiment a bit," Kapil added.

238.title: British minister sacked over allegations of 'serious misconduct'
238.article_body: British Prime Minister Liz Truss on Friday fired Conor Burns, a minister with the trade department, following a "complaint of serious misconduct", Truss's office said on Friday. "The Prime Minister took direct action on being informed of this allegation," Truss's office added. The nature of the allegation against Burns was not immediately known.

239.title: Rare pink diamond sold for world record ₹477 crore at auction in Hong Kong, pics released
239.article_body: A rare pink diamond was sold for HK$453,223,000 (around ₹477 crore) in Hong Kong on Friday, setting a world record for the highest price per carat for a diamond sold at an auction. The 11.15-carat Williamson Pink Star diamond was auctioned by Sotheby’s Hong Kong. The bidding war for the pink diamond lasted 20 minutes.

240.title: New species of beetle named after Novak Djokovic
240.article_body: Serbian scientists named a new species of beetle after ex-world number one men's tennis player Novak Djokovic. The insect, which belongs to Duvalius genus of ground beetles present in Europe and was discovered several years ago in underground pit in Serbia, has been named 'Duvalius Dokovici'. "We feel urged to pay Djokovic back in...way we can," a researcher said.

241.title: Tamil Nadu CM Stalin files nomination for DMK President post
241.article_body: Tamil Nadu CM MK Stalin on Friday filed his nomination papers seeking to contest the election for the post of Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (DMK) President. Stalin visited DMK headquarters, Anna Arivalayam, to submit the nomination papers in the presence of senior leaders. The election is likely to be held on Sunday. Notably, Stalin is the current President of DMK.

242.title: CBI files chargesheet against Lalu, 15 others in railway jobs scam
242.article_body: The CBI filed its chargesheet against RJD chief Lalu Prasad Yadav in the alleged land-for-job scam in Indian Railways on Friday. Lalu's wife Rabri Devi and 14 others have also been named as accused. The case pertains to allegations that prime properties in Patna were allegedly sold or gifted to Lalu's family members in return for railway jobs.

243.title: US, UK hold drone drill in Persian Gulf amid tensions with Iran
243.article_body: The US and the UK held a joint drone drill in the Persian Gulf on Friday. The drill included two American and two British warships and three Saildrone Explorers. The drill was held as tensions between the US and Iran have spiked in the seas recently and amidst stalled negotiations of the Iran nuclear deal.

244.title: Kidnapper, killer of Indian-origin family in US sent them angry texts: Relatives
244.article_body: The man who allegedly kidnapped and killed an Indian family of four in the US had sent them "angry texts or emails" about a year ago, relatives of the family told police. The man, identified as Jesus Salgado, worked for the family, who had a trucking business in California. He had a longstanding dispute with them, police added.

245.title: IAS officers should adopt out-of-box thinking in their work: PM Modi
245.article_body: During his address in the concluding session of the Assistant Secretary Programme 2022, PM Narendra Modi asked the IAS officers to adopt out-of-the-box thinking and a holistic approach in their work. According to an official statement, "PM Modi said that the officers have the opportunity to serve the country during the 'Amrit Kaal' and help realise the five pledges."

246.title: PM to declare Modhera as India's 1st solar-powered village on Oct 9
246.article_body: PM Narendra Modi will declare Gujarat's Modhera as India's first solar-powered village on October 9. The village will be the first in India to be a net renewable energy producer. Solar rooftops installed on more than 1,300 rural houses under the 'Solarisation of Modhera Sun Temple and Town’ project are expected to bring down electricity bills by 60-100%.

247.title: US sanctions Iranian officials for suppressing ‘peaceful protest’
247.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on seven Iranian officials, including two ministers, for allegedly suppressing "peaceful protest" in the country. Female protesters in Iran are agitating against the death of 22-year-old Mahsa Amini, who was allegedly assaulted by the police over an "improper hijab". Tehran has attempted to end the protests, resulting in the reported death of dozens of agitators.

248.title: 'Real' Rahul Gandhi emerging out of 'Bharat Jodo Yatra': Cong's Jairam
248.article_body: Congress leader Jairam Ramesh said the "real" Rahul Gandhi is emerging out of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra', which completed a month on Friday. "I wouldn't say it is the new Rahul Gandhi, but the real Rahul Gandhi that is being seen," he said. "I think what the yatra has done is to show to...Congress...that we can do it," he added.

249.title: PM not worried about World Bank's forecast, poverty report: Congress
249.article_body: Congress said PM Modi is "hardly worried" and "still indulging in empty slogans and false promises" as the World Bank trimmed India's growth forecast for FY 2022-2023. Forecasting growth at 6.5%, the World Bank said up to 5.6 crore Indians were pushed into poverty in 2020. "Farmers are committing suicide citing PM's inefficiency and apathy," said the Congress.

250.title: Amit Shah's public rallies will change political discourse in J&K: BJP
250.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir's BJP chief Ravinder Raina said Union Home Minister Amit Shah's recent public rallies will change the political discourse in the Union Territory. "The enthusiasm of people in both the rallies was unmatched and historic," Raina said. "The Modi government has devoted itself to the welfare of every community in Jammu and Kashmir beyond...region and religion," he added.

251.title: Initially I thought someone from south would play my role: Gauri on Taali
251.article_body: Transgender activist Gauri Sawant has said initially, she thought some actor or actress from the south would play her role in the upcoming web series 'Taali'. "When I was told Sushmita Sen's name, I laughed. Her Chunri Chunri song kept coming to...mind. I...couldn't believe...she would be playing my role at first. But after signing contracts, I was convinced," Gauri added.

252.title: Stones pelted as 2 groups clash during Durga Visarjan in Chhattisgarh
252.article_body: Two groups going to perform Durga Visarjan got into an altercation with each other in Chhattisgarh's Bilaspur on Friday. ASP Rajendra Jaiswal said the groups, which belonged to two different Durga Pandal committees, wanted to immerse the idol first. They started pelting stones and also used sticks and rods against each other. An idol of goddess Durga was reportedly vandalised.

253.title: Draconid meteor shower set to light up skies on October 9 &10
253.article_body: The Draconid meteor shower is all set to light up the skies between 9 to 10 October. According to NASA, these meteors are generally faint owing to their relatively slow movement as they enter Earth's atmosphere at just 40,000 mph. Hence, researchers believe, this time, the meteor might appear even fainter due to the full moon rising on October 9.

254.title: Proud that 'Ram Setu' is coming, film proves our rich history: Om Raut
254.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut, speaking about Akshay Kumar's upcoming movie 'Ram Setu', said, "Ramayana is our history, and as...proud devotee of Lord Rama I'm extremely happy since in Ram Setu it's been proved that all that happened wasn't fiction." "I even told Akshay sir that I'm very proud that this film is coming. It proves our rich history," Om added.

255.title: Pic of 'KGF' actor Yash with Lewis Hamilton goes viral
255.article_body: A picture of Kannada actor Yash with seven-time F1 world champion Lewis Hamilton has gone viral. In the photo, 'Charlie's Angels' actress Ella Balinska is also seen posing with the 'KGF' actor and Lewis at the tactical shooting facility Taran Tactical. Yash had earlier uploaded a video of him shooting at Taran Tactical and tagged Hollywood action director JJ Perry.

256.title: Gauri Lankesh's mother, sister march with Rahul amid 'Bharat Jodo'
256.article_body: The mother and sister of late journalist Gauri Lankesh, who was murdered in 2017, marched alongside Congress leader Rahul Gandhi in the Karnataka leg of the 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' on Friday. "I stand for Gauri Lankesh and countless others like her, who represent the true spirit of India," tweeted Gandhi. He added that Gauri stood for 'truth, courage and freedom'.

257.title: Fighting Presidential polls to 'save Cong's ideology, principles': Kharge
257.article_body: Senior leader Mallikarjun Kharge on Friday said that he was fighting Congress' Presidential election to "save the party's ideology and principles". Launching his campaign from Gujarat, Kharge said, "This is an internal election...I met the delegates and leaders, who in large numbers have assured to support me." "I am not fighting this election on my own will," he added.

258.title: 2 army personnel killed, 1 injured as tank barrel bursts in UP
258.article_body: Two army personnel were killed and another injured after the barrel of a T-90 tank burst during a field firing exercise in Uttar Pradesh. "The commander and the gunner, unfortunately, succumbed to burn injuries. The driver is out of danger," said an army official. He added that a court of inquiry has been launched to probe the incident.

259.title: UP CM directs officials to speed up relief work in rain-hit districts
259.article_body: Uttar Pradesh CM Yogi Adityanath has directed district magistrates of the regions affected by heavy rains to carry out relief work on priority. He instructed officials to make arrangements for drainage on priority in waterlogged areas, said an official statement issued on Friday. CM Adityanath also directed the officials to sanction compensation to relatives of the deceased, the statement said.

260.title: Harbhajan alleges illegal activities by Punjab Cricket Association, writes letter to CM
260.article_body: Punjab Cricket Association's Chief Advisor Harbhajan Singh wrote a letter to the association's stakeholders and Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann, alleging illegal activities by office-bearers. "PCA is trying hard to induct 150 members with voting rights to tilt...balance in their favour and it's being done without...assent of apex council...or without consulting Chief Advisor," the former cricketer wrote.

261.title: 2 women held, 246.95 gm heroin worth ₹50 lakh seized in Assam
261.article_body: Security forces arrested two women from Assam's Karbi Anglong district on Friday for allegedly carrying 246.95 grams of heroin worth ₹50 lakh, police said. Acting on a tip-off, the CRPF and railway police personnel seized the drugs from two women who were waiting at Bokajan railway station, police said. The drugs were reportedly hidden in 20 soap boxes.

262.title: Hong Kong to offer 5 lakh free airline tickets for tourists
262.article_body: Hong Kong recently said that it plans to give away 5 lakh airline tickets to global visitors in order to boost its COVID-19-hit tourism industry. This was confirmed by a spokesperson from the Airport Authority Hong Kong. "Back in 2020, Airport Authority Hong Kong purchased...[the]...tickets in advance from...home-based airlines as part of a relief package," said the spokesperson.

263.title: Sanju lacks experience of playing against a big team: Kamran Akmal
263.article_body: Pakistani cricketer Kamran Akmal said that India's Sanju Samson "lacks experience when it comes to playing against a big team". "Sanju took his time initially. It would have been a different story if he had attacked right from the start," Akmal said. He added, "There was a lack of intent in the first 30-35 balls that he (Samson) faced."

264.title: ED can't address unemployment and price rise: DK Shivakumar to BJP
264.article_body: Karnataka Congress President DK Shivakumar said "political battles must be fought on the political battlefield" after he appeared before the ED in a money laundering case. "BJP must understand ED can't address unemployment and price rise," added Shivakumar. He said that the "misuse of agencies by BJP" will get a "befitting reply" from the people of Karnataka in May 2023.

265.title: Argentine minister resigns after indigenous women evicted from land
265.article_body: Argentina's Minister of Women, Genders and Diversity on Thursday tendered her resignation over the eviction of a group of indigenous Mapuche women from land in the Patagonia region. Elizabeth Gomez Alcorta had criticised the eviction and subsequent arrest of six Mapuche women, one of whom was pregnant. The government has defended the eviction, which was ordered by a court.

266.title: PM scared of offending Chinese Prez?: Owaisi on India abstaining on UN vote
266.article_body: AIMIM President Asaduddin Owaisi said PM Modi should explain why India 'helped' China by abstaining on a draft UNHRC resolution seeking a debate on the human rights situation in Xinjiang. "Is he so scared of offending Xi Jinping, whom he met 18 times?" tweeted Owaisi. The Indian government said the decision was "in line with its long-held position".

267.title: VFX in 'Adipurush' was difficult to digest: Sunil Lahri
267.article_body: Actor Sunil Lahri, who portrayed the role of Laxman in Ramanand Sagar's 'Ramayan', said it was difficult for him to "digest" the VFX in the teaser of 'Adipurush'. Adding there were no "cartoonish effects" in his serial, Sunil said, "Earlier it was all manual, now it's all presets and they stick to that. They don't want to make any effort."

268.title: Shinde quit Sena, can't claim 'bow & arrow' symbol: Thackeray camp to EC
268.article_body: Former Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray's camp on Friday told the Election Commission (EC) that the Eknath Shinde-led faction cannot claim the 'bow and arrow' symbol as he and other MLAs in his camp had "voluntarily quit the party". This comes after Shinde's faction submitted a memorandum, seeking it be allocated the symbol ahead of the Andheri East Assembly bypoll.

269.title: Negative people in industry didn't want 'Brahmastra' to work: Karan Johar
269.article_body: Speaking about facing negativity for his film 'Brahmastra' from his own fraternity, filmmaker Karan Johar said being a part of the same industry, people sometimes don't want the film to work. "Sometimes people within the industry, who call themselves members of...media also, celebrate ruination of a film," he said. "You can be critical but being negative isn't nice," Karan added.

270.title: SSC exams only in Hindi, English discriminatory: Former K'taka CM
270.article_body: Former Karnataka CM HD Kumaraswamy on Friday said it is discriminatory to conduct the Staff Selection Commission (SSC) exams for central government departments only in English and Hindi. He accused the Centre of trying to suppress regional languages. He further demanded that the government must conduct SSC exams in Kannada too, so that "talented people" of Karnataka can get selected.

271.title: Akshay, John, Abhishek, Bobby & Riteish to star in 'Housefull 5': Report
271.article_body: Akshay Kumar, John Abraham, Abhishek Bachchan, Bobby Deol and Riteish Deshmukh are reportedly teaming up for the fifth instalment of the 'Housefull' franchise. The film is expected to go on floors in 2023, report said. Akshay and Riteish have appeared in all parts of the franchise. John, Abhishek and Bobby starred in 'Housefull 2', 'Housefull 3' and 'Housefull 4' respectively.

272.title: Be extra cautious while travelling to India due to crime, terrorism: US in advisory
272.article_body: The US has issued a new advisory warning its citizens to "exercise increased caution in India due to crime and terrorism". It also tells Americans to not travel to the Union Territory of J&K (except Ladakh and Leh), and within 10 km of the India-Pakistan border. It says, "Indian authorities report rape is one of the fastest-growing crimes in India".

273.title: B'wood must make 'Kaho Naa...' sequel with Anil & me: Actor's lookalike
273.article_body: American bodybuilder John Effer, who went viral for having a resemblance to actor Anil Kapoor, has said he wants to act in a Bollywood film. "I feel Bollywood must make a 'Kaho Naa...Pyaar Hai' part 2 with Anil Kapoor and [me]," he added. John further said all he wants is to have a life that's as 'jhakaas' as him.

274.title: Sanju pushed us at the end, but boys stood firm: Bavuma
274.article_body: After winning the first ODI in Lucknow, South African captain Temba Bavuma said that India's wicketkeeper-batter Sanju Samson pushed them "at the end" but the Proteas players "stood firm". "There wasn't much grass on the surface, we lost a couple of wickets in the middle overs, myself and Aiden (Markram), but the boys knuckled down," Bavuma said.

275.title: Pic shows Team India's 16 backroom staff members for T20 World Cup 2022
275.article_body: As many as 16 backroom staff members are accompanying Team India squad for the T20 World Cup 2022 in Australia. The backroom staff is led by head coach Rahul Dravid. The backroom staff includes batting coach Vikram Rathour, bowling coach Paras Mhambrey and fielding coach T Dilip. It also includes media manager Moulin Parikh.

276.title: Will fence tracks by 2024: Railways after Vande Bharat Express hits buffaloes
276.article_body: A day after the new Vande Bharat Express train sustained damages after hitting buffaloes on Thursday, the Western Railway has said it aims to begin fencing work and complete it by 2024 to avoid such accidents in future. The local railway staff have been asked to counsel villagers regularly to not let their cattle wander near the tracks.

277.title: Juvenile tasked with 'eliminating' Salman Khan among 2 arrested by Delhi Police
277.article_body: Two terror accused have been arrested in connection to the May 9 RPG attack at Punjab Police headquarters in Mohali, Delhi Police said on Friday. One of them, a juvenile, was also tasked with "eliminating" actor Salman Khan, police said. The juvenile was instructed to target Salman by the Lawrence Bishnoi and Jaggu Bhagwanpuria syndicate, officials further said.

278.title: Verdict on carbon dating of 'Shivling' in Gyanvapi mosque deferred till Oct 11
278.article_body: A court in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Friday deferred till October 11 the hearing on the Hindu side's plea seeking carbon dating of the structure they claimed to be a 'Shivling' found inside the Gyanvapi Mosque. The Anjuman Intezamia Masjid Committee's arguments will be heard by the court on October 11, following which it'll pronounce its order on the matter.

279.title: ED attaches Amnesty-linked entity's assets worth ₹1.54 cr
279.article_body: The ED has provisionally attached assets worth ₹1.54 crore belonging to Indians for Amnesty International Trust (IAIT) under the Prevention of Money Laundering Act (PMLA), the agency informed on Friday. The money laundering case is based on an FIR registered by the CBI against Indian entities of Amnesty International for the alleged violation of the Foreign Contribution (Regulation) Act (FCRA).

280.title: Free a dying man: Daughter of jailed Kashmiri separatist leader Altaf
280.article_body: Kashmiri separatist leader Altaf Ahmad Shah's daughter has said her father is on ventilator in a critical condition and should be granted bail on humanitarian grounds. The 66-year-old, who was recently diagnosed with renal cancer, has been lodged in Tihar jail since 2017. "These are his final days...We appeal to the courts to free a dying man," his daughter said.

281.title: New supercontinent 'Amasia' will be created as Pacific ocean shrinks: Study
281.article_body: As per researchers, a new supercontinent will be created as the Pacific ocean is slowly closing up. It's shrinking by around one inch a year, due to which the tectonic plates on which the Americas rest are getting pushed westwards, they said. After 200-300 million years, the landmasses of Americas and Asia might collide to create a new supercontinent, Amasia.

282.title: If you give a sh*t, ask yourself why you're watching: Sajid's accuser as he joins Bigg Boss
282.article_body: A woman who accused Sajid Khan of inappropriate behaviour during #MeToo movement has spoken out after he was announced as a contestant on 'Bigg Boss 16'. "If you really give a sh*t, ask yourself why you're watching," she wrote on Instagram. "If you are someone that...genuinely wants to support the women who spoke up – WORK WITH THEM," she added.

283.title: I have lost 7-8 kg since last IPL, Chinese food is totally out of my menu: Prithvi Shaw
283.article_body: Cricketer Prithvi Shaw, who hasn't played for India since July 2021, said he has worked on his weight loss. He revealed he has lost 7-8 kg since the last IPL. "I spent a lot of time in...gym, did a lot of running, didn’t consume any sweets and cold drinks. Chinese food is totally out of my menu now," Shaw said.

284.title: Alarming: MEA as 6 Indian prisoners die in Pak in last 9 months
284.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) on Friday said six Indian prisoners, including five fishermen, have died in Pakistani custody in the last nine months. "They completed their sentences, but were illegally detained by Pakistan...These incidents are alarming," MEA Spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said. "Pakistan is duty-bound to maintain the safety and security of Indian prisoners," Bagchi added.

285.title: Man trampled to death by elephant in Odisha
285.article_body: A 30-year-old man was trampled to death by an elephant in the foothills of the Similipal National Park in Jamdapal village in Odisha's Mayurbhanj district. The deceased, Ratha Behera, was attacked when he was going to the Budhabalanga river to take a bath. Behera was admitted to a community health centre, where he succumbed to his injuries, an official said.

286.title: Govt explains why India abstained from voting on UN debate on China's abuse of Uyghurs
286.article_body: The Ministry of External Affairs (MEA) has said that India is "committed to all human rights" after abstaining from voting on a UN Human Rights Commission debate on China's alleged abuse of Uyghur Muslims. "India's vote...is in line with its long-held position that country-specific resolutions are never helpful. India favours a dialogue to deal with such issues," said the MEA.

287.title: People call me 'kachra': Bigg Boss 16's Abdu on social media trolls
287.article_body: The world's smallest singer Abdu Rozik, in a recent episode of 'Bigg Boss 16', spoke about social media trolling and said, "In my Instagram so many people come and write bad stuff to me, hey you're kachra, bad, very bad." However, he added that it makes him "strong". "Life can't always be happy, there are sad moments also," said Abdu.

288.title: It will be difficult to get right team for 2023 World Cup: VVS
288.article_body: Former Indian cricketer VVS Laxman said that the country has a "good bunch of cricketers". "The competition between them (cricketers) is good, we are spoiled for choices considering the amount of talent we have," Laxman said. He added, "It'll be difficult for the selectors to get the right team going into the 2023 50-over World Cup."

289.title: Art cannot be produced in an atmosphere of fear: Swara on boycott culture
289.article_body: Actress Swara Bhasker, reacting to recent social media trends demanding a boycott of several Bollywood films, said that art cannot be produced in an atmosphere of fear. "The more you limit freedom and build an atmosphere of fear, the more your art, culture, your entertainment, and artistic performances will suffer," she added.

290.title: Tiger mauls 35-yr-old man to death near Bihar's Valmiki Tiger Reserve
290.article_body: A 35-year-old man, identified as Sanjay Mahato, was mauled to death by a tiger near Bihar's Valmiki Tiger Reserve (VTR). "So far, four people have been killed by this tiger alone. We're doing everything to catch it," VTR Field Director Neshamani K said. Mahato had gone to relieve himself in Dumari village when he was attacked, forest officials said.

291.title: 'Chudel' village in Guj to be renamed as Chandanpur, proposal sent to panchayat
291.article_body: Gujarat BJP MP Prabhu Vasava has sent a proposal to the Surat panchayat to change the name of the Chudel village in the Mandvi taluka of the district. The gram panchayat has proposed to change the name of 'Chudel', which means 'witch', to 'Chandanpur'. The proposal for the name change was also introduced in Parliament, as per reports.

292.title: Hyderabad Metro services to be extended till 11 pm from Oct 10
292.article_body: The L&T Metro Rail Hyderabad Limited in a statement said the metro train services will be extended until 11 pm from October 10. "The last train will leave at 11 pm from...terminal stations while starting the daily services at...6 am," HMRL MD NVS Reddy said. The Hyderabad Metro Rail has also launched the facility to book tickets on WhatsApp.

293.title: Vande Bharat Express hits cow a day after hitting buffaloes, suffers dent; pic surfaces
293.article_body: The Gandhinagar-Mumbai Vande Bharat Express hit a cow near Anand station in Gujarat on Friday, resulting in a dent to the train's nose panel, an official said. On Thursday, the newly-launched semi-high speed train had hit four buffaloes and its nose cone had to be replaced. The incident on Friday took place after around 3.45 pm.

294.title: Govt exam candidates can take test wearing kara, kirpan: Delhi HC
294.article_body: The Delhi High Court (HC) has allowed candidates appearing for Union Government or Delhi government examinations to wear kara and kirpan. The court was hearing a plea filed by the Delhi Sikh Gurdwara Management Committee. The court said such candidates must reach the examination venue one hour before the reporting time to help with a search.

295.title: GB Nagar records ₹6-cr rise in liquor sale revenue for September
295.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar recorded an increase of ₹6 crore in revenue from liquor sales this September compared to the month before, officials said. Revenue from liquor sales in September was ₹126.43 crore, while the revenue in August was ₹120.34 crore. District Excise Officer RB Singh said the increase in revenue was due to the reversal of the excise policy.

296.title: QR codes rolled out at B'luru traffic signals for cardiac emergencies
296.article_body: Bengaluru's Manipal Hospitals has installed QR codes at 15 major traffic signals across the city to help people with cardiac emergencies. These codes can navigate people through the correct steps involved in CPR. QR codes to help people connect to emergency number for quick ambulance service have also been installed at signals. The initiative is supported by civic body BBMP.

297.title: K Prabhakar Reddy to be TRS' candidate for Munugode by-election
297.article_body: TRS chief and Telangana CM K Chandrashekar Rao on Friday announced K Prabhakar Reddy as the party candidate for the Munugode by-election. The Munugode Assembly seat became vacant after Congress MLA Komatireddy Raj Gopal Reddy resigned on August 8 and joined BJP in presence of Home Minister Amit Shah. The by-elections for the seat will be held on November 3.

298.title: Indore cleanest due to civic workers & citizens, not officials: BJP leader
298.article_body: BJP leader Kailash Vijayvargiya on Friday said the credit for Indore being ranked as the cleanest city in India by Centre's Swachh Survekshan survey must go to 'safai mitras' and citizens instead of officials. "They [citizens] are...cultured and disciplined due to their ancestors," Vijayvargiya said. Indore was followed by Surat and Navi Mumbai in the cleanest city category of 2022.

299.title: Vehicle registrations during festivals doubled compared to 2021: Pune RTO
299.article_body: Vehicle registrations more than doubled in this year's Navratri and Dussehra festivals compared to last year, the Pune Regional Transport Office (RTO) said. From September 26 to October 5 this year, the RTO registered 9,665 vehicles, compared to 4,330 vehicles registered during the festival last year. Of this year's Navratri tally, 5,914 two-wheelers and 2,984 four-wheelers were registered.

300.title: Suryakumar's wife helps him wear Team India blazer ahead of T20 World Cup, MI share video
300.article_body: Mumbai Indians took to Instagram to share a video showing Suryakumar Yadav's wife Devisha helping him wear his Team India blazer ahead of T20 World Cup 2022. "Moment hai, bhai! Moment hai! Good luck, Surya," the caption read. The video also comprised 'Bhaag Milkha Bhaag' dialogue that translates to, "You don't just get India's coat, you have to earn it."

301.title: 3 arrested after local cricket match takes violent turn in Pune
301.article_body: Three people have been arrested and a case was filed under IPC Section 307 (attempt to murder) among other offences after a local cricket match took a violent turn in Pune. The arrested allegedly attacked the victim with sticks and a sickle on Tuesday. The arrested accused were identified as Avinash Suresh Sharma, Vikas Simban Gaud and Sagar Bhagwat Warkari.

302.title: Iran denies security forces killed minor, says she fell off roof
302.article_body: Iranian authorities have refuted reports claiming a 16-year-old girl was killed by security forces during protests over Mahsa Amini's death, Iranian media reported on Friday. The minor, Sarina Esmaeilzadeh, committed suicide by falling off a roof, authorities added. Earlier this week, authorities gave a similar cause of death for another girl who was allegedly killed during anti-hijab protests.

303.title: South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius ruled out of T20 World Cup 2022
303.article_body: South Africa all-rounder Dwaine Pretorius has been ruled out of the T20 World Cup in Australia due to a fracture in his left thumb. Pretorius sustained the injury during the third T20I against India on Tuesday in Indore. Pretorius was the joint-highest wicket-taker for South Africa in the T20 World Cup last year.

304.title: J'khand man set ablaze over inter-community love affair; 11 arrested
304.article_body: As many as 11 people have been arrested for allegedly setting a man on fire over an inter-community love affair in Jharkhand's Dhawaiya village, police informed on Friday. The deceased, who hailed from the Muslim community, was having an affair with a woman from a different community. Local residents attacked him as they weren't happy with this, Bokaro SP said.

305.title: Over 7 kg gold seized from passengers arriving from Dubai at Hyd airport
305.article_body: Hyderabad customs officials have seized 7.6 kg of gold at Rajiv Gandhi International Airport. In one case, 4.8 kg of gold worth ₹2.57 crore was seized from a male passenger arriving from Dubai. While in another case, two passengers from Dubai were arrested after customs officials seized 24 gold bars weighing 2.8 kg worth ₹1.47 crore from their check-in baggage.

306.title: No FIR yet against builder for felling 560 trees in Mumbai: Report
306.article_body: Mumbai Police is yet to reportedly file an FIR against a builder group who felled 560 trees illegally on a private plot in Goregaon. The local resident who filed the complaint said the BMC allegedly did not take any action for over a month. The civic body then wrote to the police allegedly confirming that the trees were felled illegally.

307.title: Jharkhand man dies after allegedly being mob lynched in Bengaluru
307.article_body: A man died after allegedly being attacked by a mob on suspicion of being a child-lifter in Ramamurthy Nagar, Bengaluru. The deceased, Sanjay Tudu (33), worked as a mason and was a native of Jharkhand. According to police, it took them eight days to identify the deceased. Notably, six people have been taken into custody for questioning, police said.

308.title: BJP files complaint against Kejriwal, AAP MLA over mass conversion video
308.article_body: BJP on Friday filed a complaint against Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal and AAP MLA Rajendra Pal Gautam after the latter attended a mass conversion event where around 10,000 people embraced Buddhism. A video showed attendees pledging not to worship Hindu gods and goddesses. BJP accused the leaders of attempting to incite violence and divide India on the basis of religion.

309.title: Mumbai man gets scrap paper after paying ₹3 lakh for US dollars
309.article_body: Thane Police has filed a case against five people who cheated an autorickshaw driver by taking ₹3 lakh from him in lieu of US dollars and then delivering scrap paper. The man from Mumbai's Bhandup was convinced to give the money by one of his female passengers who promised him dollars. The driver was promised 635 notes for his money.

310.title: Man kills father over property dispute in Gurugram; arrested
310.article_body: A 26-year-old man was arrested for allegedly killing his 52-year-old father using his car equipment in Gurugram. "The accused's grandfather had given some land to his father and aunt. He was not happy with this decision and had developed an enmity with his father and aunt," police said. He had frequent quarrels with his father on the matter.

311.title: Abhishek, Rashmika Mandanna condole Arun Bali's demise
311.article_body: Several celebrities took to social media to express condolences on the demise of veteran actor Arun Bali. Abhishek Bachchan tweeted, "Very sad to hear of the passing of Arun Bali Ji...A wonderfully warm and loving man. Had...pleasure to share screen space with him on several films." Rashmika Mandanna, who worked with Arun in his last film 'Goodbye', wrote, "Truly saddened."

312.title: Delhi Police arrest 2 men involved in terror activities
312.article_body: The Special Cell of Delhi Police has arrested two men for their alleged involvement in terror activities, an officer said on Friday. One of them was wanted in connection with the RPG attack on Punjab Police Intelligence headquarters in May this year. The second accused has been arrested in connection with the recovery of an IED in Haryana in August.

313.title: Pune fire dept issues new number after helpline develops technical glitch
313.article_body: After the 101 emergency number of the Pune fire brigade developed technical glitches, the fire department issued a new helpline number. People can now call on 020-26451707 in case of any fire emergency. "The 101 emergency number of the bridge is dysfunctional now, and it gives out some recorded messages regarding insurance companies," an official of the fire brigade said.

314.title: Former South African Prez Zuma set free after prison term ends
314.article_body: South Africa's former President Jacob Zuma has been released from jail upon the expiration of his prison sentence for contempt of court, South African authorities said on Friday. Zuma received a 15-month prison term last year after he ignored instructions to participate in a corruption inquiry. He surrendered on July 7 last year to begin his sentence.

315.title: I'm follower of Lord Ram, haven't tampered with history: 'Adipurush' maker
315.article_body: 'Adipurush' director Om Raut addressed the criticism that his film has been receiving and said that he is a big follower of Lord Ram and has "done nothing wrong in this film". "We have not tampered with history, and I would call this history, our proud history. We kept the purity of this history while working on this," Om added.

316.title: Police seek Forest Dept's help after python spotted in Hyd graveyard
316.article_body: Hyderabad's Chatrinaka Police have sought Forest Department's help to catch a python which was found crawling in Quadri Chaman graveyard in Falaknuma. Police want to safely shift the snake to a forest. This comes after a video of the python moving from one grave onto another surfaced online. It has reportedly been spotted in the graveyard for about one week.

317.title: India raises objection as US envoy visits Pak-occupied-Kashmir, calls it 'Azad J&K'
317.article_body: The Indian government has raised an objection over the recent visit to Pakistan-occupied-Kashmir (PoK) by the US ambassador to Pakistan Donald Blome. Ministry of External Affairs spokesperson Arindam Bagchi said the objection has been conveyed to the US. Blome had, during the recent visit, repeatedly referred to the region as 'Azad Jammu and Kashmir'.

318.title: Iranian coroner rules out blows to body as cause of Amini's death
318.article_body: An Iranian coroner's report into the death of Mahsa Amini has ruled out blows to the head and limbs as the cause of her death, Iran's state media reported on Friday. The coroner's report said that Amini died from multiple organ failure caused by cerebral hypoxia. She fell while in custody due to "underlying diseases", the report added.

319.title: Massive fire breaks out at Noida factory, several fire tenders reach spot
319.article_body: A massive fire broke out on Friday at a factory in Noida's sector 3 following which several fire tenders reached the spot. The fire reportedly broke out at a factory for manufacturing plastic trays used in modular kitchens. Spot visuals showed thick black smoke emanating from the building and efforts to douse the fire are ongoing.

320.title: What is Myasthenia Gravis, the rare autoimmune disease Arun Bali was suffering from?
320.article_body: Veteran actor Arun Bali, who passed away on Friday, was suffering from Myasthenia Gravis. It's a rare neuromuscular disease in which weakness of skeletal muscles happens. This happens when communication between muscles and nerve cells becomes impaired due to certain deficiencies in chemicals. Symptoms include double vision, difficulty in speaking, chewing, swallowing and difficulty in walking.

321.title: Rahul Gandhi should undertake 'Congress Jodo Yatra': UP BJP chief
321.article_body: Uttar Pradesh BJP chief Bhupendra Singh Chaudhary on Friday advised Rahul Gandhi to undertake a 'Congress Jodo Yatra'. Rahul Gandhi should have started his 'Bharat Jodo Yatra' from Pakistan's Peshawar, Karachi or Islamabad, Chaudhary said. "It was during the Congress government that partition of the country took place. After that, there has been no division," Chaudhary added.

322.title: Two men arrested for trying to snatch gold chain in Thane
322.article_body: Two men were arrested for allegedly trying to snatch a gold chain from a man in Thane, Maharashtra. The accused, Rashid Ansari (24) and Vasim Rais Shaikh (20), tried to snatch it from a 26-year-old man near the Anjurphata railway bridge before the victim resisted the attempt, police said. The accused also attacked the victim with a knife.

323.title: FIR against two MP Congress MLAs for allegedly harassing woman in train
323.article_body: An FIR was registered against Madhya Pradesh Congress MLAs Siddharth Kushwaha and Suneel Saraf for allegedly harassing a woman in a train. The victim said they forced her to have a meal with them and one of them held her hand when she refused. Kushwaha, however, said he only exchanged his berth with her and had no conversation with her.

324.title: It referred to sanctions: Ukraine on Zelenskyy's 'preventive strike' remark
324.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy was referring to imposing sanctions on Russia when he suggested preventive strikes were necessary to preclude any use of nuclear weapons, his spokesperson, Serhii Nykyforov, said. The hints at the use of nuclear weapons were "afforded only by the terrorist state Russia. You will never hear such calls from Ukraine", Nykyforov added.

325.title: Flipkart spent $1.1 billion in 6 months: Walmart filings
325.article_body: Flipkart spent $1.1 billion in cash between February 1 and July 31 this year, parent company Walmart's filings with the US Securities and Exchange Commission showed. The company's cash and cash equivalents fell from $2.2 billion at the end of January 2022 to $1.1 billion at the end of July 2022. Flipkart's spending was on mergers, acquisitions and capital expenditure.

326.title: West needs to build strong deterrence to keep Kremlin at bay: Lithuania
326.article_body: Lithuanian President Gitanas Nauseda on Friday said the West must build strong deterrence in its support of Ukraine to make sure that Russia doesn't want to risk expanding the war. "We've to be strong and not let us [be] manipulated because...Kremlin regime is very good at that," Nauseda added as he arrived in Prague for an EU summit.

327.title: Google to invest $690 million in Japan, open its 1st data centre in the country
327.article_body: Google is planning to invest $690 million in Japan through 2024, its CEO Sundar Pichai told Nikkei on Friday. Google will open a data centre in Chiba Prefecture near Tokyo in 2023, its first in Japan, for faster access to Google's services. Japan will be the third data centre location in Asia after Taiwan and Singapore.

328.title: At least 705 absentee doctors still drawing money from government: Tejashwi
328.article_body: Bihar Deputy CM Tejashwi Yadav claimed that at least 705 government doctors are still getting their monthly salaries even though they have been absent from work for more than six months. He said that many doctors posted in rural areas didn't work there and instead continued to practice in urban areas. He has announced to take strict action against them.

329.title: Delhi hospital uses over a century-old procedure to treat Iraqi man's leg
329.article_body: Doctors at a Delhi hospital here treated a 40-year-old Iraqi national's leg using the cross-leg flap surgery which is an over a century-old technique, reports said. The doctors at Fortis Hospital, Vasant Kunj, decided to perform the procedure as the newer ones were not feasible considering his health. A doctor said that the leg is recovering well.

330.title: Pic of MS Dhoni's wax statue in Mysore goes viral, fan asks 'Where is MS Dhoni?'
330.article_body: A picture of MS Dhoni's wax statue in Mysore has gone viral on social media. Several fans stated that the statue doesn't resemble Dhoni, with one tweeting, "Where is MS Dhoni?" Renowned cricket writer Jarrod Kimber wrote, "That's a big no from me." Other tweets read, "The guy in the red looks like Dhoni than the statue" and "Burn it".

331.title: Friends couldn't believe it: Gajraj on playing Madhuri's husband in Maja Ma
331.article_body: Actor Gajraj Rao, who plays Madhuri Dixit's husband in 'Maja Ma', revealed that when he told his friends about his role in the film, they "couldn't believe it". "They [asked], 'Gajju, are you sure...you've been paired alongside Madhuri Dixit as her husband? You are her hero!' I told them it's not a hero-heroine story. It's a family story," Gajraj said.

332.title: After Elon Musk revived Twitter deal, Tesla shares fell nearly 2%
332.article_body: After Elon Musk decided to revive his Twitter offer earlier this week, Tesla shares fell by 1.8%. The stock has lost 34% since the Tesla CEO first disclosed a stake in Twitter on April 4. Musk has already offloaded over $15 billion of Twitter's stock this year and according to Bloomberg, he holds 465 million shares as of August 9.

333.title: Mukarram Jah Trust to restore 6th palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad
333.article_body: The sixth palace of the Nizam of Hyderabad located in Purani Haveli premises will be renovated by the Mukarram Jah Trust for educational purposes, a press release from the palace said. "The infrastructure will also have a sports arena inside the Purani Haveli premises...to [provide] coaching and training facilities to girls," MA Faiz Khan, Trustee of Mukarram Jah Trust, said.

334.title: US accuses Russia of exploiting African resources to fund war in Ukraine
334.article_body: The US has accused Russian mercenaries of exploiting natural resources in Central African Republic, Mali, Sudan and other areas to fund Ukraine war. "People across Africa are paying heavy price for Wagner Group's exploitative practices and human rights violations," US Ambassador to UN, Linda Thomas-Greenfield, told UN Security Council. Wagner fought in Libya, Syria and Mali, among other countries.

335.title: Hope it helps release him: Belarus opp'n as Bialiatski wins Nobel prize
335.article_body: The Nobel Peace Prize to Belarusian human rights activist Ales Bialiatski recognises Belarusians who stood up to authoritarian leader Alexander Lukashenko, opposition spokesman Franak Viacorka said. "This prize will help...attract attention to political prisoners...Bialiatski is one of them. He's kept in inhuman conditions and we hope it will help...release him and thousands of others," he added.

336.title: Bharti Airtel stock gains after rollout of 5G services in 8 cities
336.article_body: A day after Bharti Airtel launched its 5G services in eight cities across India, for which customers will have to pay as per their existing 4G plan, its stock gained on Friday. Global brokerage firm, Morgan Stanley has an 'overweight' stance on the company and expects a further 4.6% upside in its shares to ₹825 apiece from Thursday's closing price.

337.title: Pics show aerial view of US' Florida before and after Hurricane Ian's approach
337.article_body: NASA shared satellite images showing aerial view of US' Florida before and after the approach of "extremely dangerous" Hurricane Ian. "Turquoise colour is likely sediment that Ian lifted from...seafloor," said NASA. Prior to the storm, there was already some colour, but much of that is due to light reflecting off sea grass beds, seafloor and coral reefs, it added.

338.title: Wasn't trying to look sexy: Doja to troll calling her gold look 'ugly'
338.article_body: Rapper-singer Doja Cat replied to a troll who called her gold look at Paris Fashion Week 'ugly'. "The paint is making her look ugly...She looks like...tired old statue," the user tweeted. Doja replied, "I wasn't trying to look sexy or attractive...All of my makeup has...story and there are absolutely 0 rules and if there were you wouldn't be...one making them."

339.title: Real development of northeast began after Modi became PM: Amit Shah
339.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah claimed that the real development of northeast region of India began only after Modi took over the office of Prime Minister in 2014. "In the 75 years of independence, before Narendra Modi became PM, the northeast was considered only a tourist destination...The government has decided to set up around 65,000 active [agricultural societies]," said Shah.

340.title: 250 acres in Global City project will be auctioned by November: Haryana CM
340.article_body: The Haryana government is planning to auction 250 acres of land for the proposed Global City in Gurugram by November this year. CM Manohar Lal Khattar claimed that 13 Dubai-based companies are likely to invest in it. "Plots will be sold in a mixed land use format and size will vary from 100 acres to 5 acres," said the CM.

341.title: BEST plans to have a fleet of 5,000 e-bikes at bus stops by 2023
341.article_body: The Brihanmumbai Electric Supply and Transport (BEST) plans to have a fleet of 5,000 e-bikes at bus stops across Mumbai for last mile connectivity by 2023. "These vehicles can be picked up and dropped off at any e-bike station," Lokesh Chandra, General Manager of BEST, said. "This...strengthens BEST's position as the country's number one technology-oriented transport undertaking," he added.

342.title: Leopard enters Maha house in bid to chase dog, forest officials cage it
342.article_body: A leopard reportedly entered a house in a Maharashtra village in a bid to chase down a dog. The owner of the house locked the house from the outside, reports said. The forest officials were then called, after which, efforts to cage the leopard were initiated. The leopard was caught after four hours.

343.title: 7 out of 8 RRTS stations in Ghaziabad to have footbridges
343.article_body: Seven out of the eight Regional Rapid Transit System (RRTS) stations in the Ghaziabad district will have footbridge facilities for passengers and regular pedestrians, the National Capital Region Transport Corporation (NCRTC) has said. The 82-km-long RRTS project, pegged at ₹30,274 cr, will link Delhi, Ghaziabad and Meerut with a high-speed train network with a design speed of 180 km/h.

344.title: Police and fans clash during soccer match in Argentina; 1 dead
344.article_body: At least one person died amid clashes between police and soccer fans on Thursday during a local tournament match in Argentina. The person died of a heart problem, an official said. According to authorities and witnesses, police fired tear gas and rubber bullets to disperse a crowd of home team fans trying to make their way into a packed stadium.

345.title: Who is Ales Bialiatski, this year's Nobel Peace Prize winner?
345.article_body: Jailed Belarusian human rights activist Ales Bialiatski is among three winners of the Nobel Peace Prize this year. The 60-year-old is the Founder of the Viasna (Spring) Human Rights Centre, set up in 1996, which supported jailed protesters and documented the use of torture by authorities against political prisoners. President Alexander Lukashenko's regime has detained him without trial since 2020.

346.title: Punjab's youngest MLA Narinder Kaur Bharaj marries AAP worker
346.article_body: Narinder Kaur Bharaj, the 28-year-old Aam Aadmi Party (AAP) MLA from Sangrur, got married to a 29-year-old party worker named Mandeep Singh Lakhewal at a gurdwara in Patiala on Friday. Sharing a picture from the wedding ceremony, MLA Amarinder Singh Raja Warring congratulated the couple on social media. Bharaj, a law graduate, is the youngest MLA in the Punjab Assembly.

347.title: 5 persons booked for housing society fraud of ₹82 lakh in Thane
347.article_body: Five persons, including an official of state cooperative department, were booked for their alleged involvement in misappropriating funds of ₹82 lakh of a housing society in Thane, police said. "Other accused are civil and electrical contractors who were given various works," police added. A probe is underway and no arrests have been made so far, police said.

348.title: 3 killed as speeding car rams into parked truck in Assam's Kamrup
348.article_body: At least three persons were killed after a speeding car hit a parked truck near Sonapur in Assam's Kamrup Metropolitan district on Thursday night, police said. The car was going towards Guwahati when it hit the truck on NH-37, police added. Earlier, three members of a family were killed after a four-wheeler and a truck collided in Biswanath in September.

349.title: Multilevel flyover construction delayed due to traffic issues in Pune
