349.article_body: The work on multilevel flyover at the Pune University junction has been delayed due to the traffic issues that are being caused by the construction of another multilevel flyover at Chandani Chowk. "PMC requested to postpone the work due to traffic issues. The work will start next week but before that...we have convened a meeting of officers," an official said.

350.title: Ukraine's preventive strike comments justify our military operation: Russia
350.article_body: Russian Foreign Minister Sergei Lavrov said on Friday that Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's remarks suggesting NATO should launch preventive strikes on Russia confirmed the need for what Moscow calls its "special military operation" in Ukraine. Zelenskyy told an Australian think tank that he believed strikes were necessary to prevent any use of nuclear weapons.

351.title: Rapido driver asks for rider's phone to make call, runs away with it in Mumbai
351.article_body: A Rapido driver reportedly fled with a rider's phone in Mumbai. A 17-year-old student had booked the bike taxi to Opera House on Monday. When he asked the driver to stop midway for a minute, the latter asked for his phone to make an urgent call. Before the boy realised, the driver sped away on his scooter with the phone.

352.title: God put you in power: Russian Orthodox leader to Putin on his 70th b'day
352.article_body: The head of the Russian Orthodox Church Patriarch Kirill wished Russian President Vladimir Putin on his 70th birthday on Friday. "God put you in power so that you could perform a service of special importance and of great responsibility for the fate of the country and the people entrusted to your care," the patriarch said.

353.title: Gautam Adani to invest ₹65,000 cr in Rajasthan, create 40,000 jobs
353.article_body: Adani Group Chairman Gautam Adani will invest ₹65,000 crore in Rajasthan over the next five to seven years and create more than 40,000 direct and indirect jobs. Adani said his group has already invested over ₹35,000 crore across multiple sectors in Rajasthan. Adani Group also achieved commercial operations of the world's largest wind-solar hybrid power plant in Rajasthan, he added.

354.title: India lose a women's international cricket match against Pakistan after more than 6 years
354.article_body: Pakistan defeated India by 13 runs in their Women's Asia Cup T20 2022 match on Friday. Pakistan put up a total of 137/6 and dismissed India for 124. This is the first time in more than six years that Pakistan have defeated India in women's international cricket. Further, it is India's first defeat in Women's Asia Cup T20 2022.

355.title: Man sets woman on fire for rejecting marriage proposal in J'khand
355.article_body: A man was arrested after he allegedly set a 22-year-old woman on fire for rejecting his marriage proposal in Jharkhand's Dumka. "[The accused] had entered [the woman's] home on Friday morning, poured petrol on her when she was asleep and set her ablaze," a sub-divisional police officer told PTI. The accused is already married, the sub-divisional police officer said.

356.title: 3 miscreants fire at man standing outside his home in Gurugram
356.article_body: At least three miscreants allegedly shot at a man while he was standing outside his home in Gurugram's Arjun Nagar, police said. The firing took place in connection with liquor smuggling, police added. The attackers came from both sides of the street riding two scooties and fired at him and ran away, the victim's mother said.

357.title: Arrested driver in Bandra-Worli Sea Link accident had 28 challans: Report
357.article_body: Irfan Abdul Raheem Beelkia, the driver who has been arrested for killing five people and injuring several others in an accident on the Bandra-Worli Sea Link, has had 28 e-challans against his vehicle. Unpaid challans amount to ₹28,800, reports said. Officers reportedly added that the accused had been fined for overspeeding on the Sea Link five days before the incident.

358.title: Orcas caught chasing, killing great white shark on video for the first time
358.article_body: Scientists have confirmed that orcas hunt great white sharks, after drone and helicopter footage showed first evidence of a pod of orcas killing a great white near Mossel Bay in South Africa. The footage shows five killer whales chasing the sharks in an hour-long pursuit, before killing one of them. Researchers believe that three other sharks may also have been killed.

359.title: 11 arrested in Faridabad for cheating 1,398 people across 26 states
359.article_body: Faridabad Police on Thursday arrested 11 members of a gang for allegedly cheating 1,398 people across 26 states. Police recovered six mobile phones, three SIM cards, 19 debit cards, eight chequebooks and ₹25,300 from them. "The fraud came to light after a Faridabad woman was cheated of ₹39,000 on September 20 after she received a new credit card," police said.

360.title: Man who undressed himself before woman walking her dog arrested in Mumbai
360.article_body: A 32-year-old man, booked for behaving indecently in front of a 23-year-old college student in south Mumbai, was arrested on Wednesday after 100 days of investigation. On June 17, the accused allegedly undressed himself in front of the woman when she was walking her dog below the Kennedy Bridge and behaved indecently. Later, an FIR was registered against him.

361.title: Comedian Judy Tenuta, also known as 'The Love Goddess', dies of ovarian cancer at 72
361.article_body: Stand-up comedian Judy Tenuta, also known as "The Love Goddess" passed away aged 72 on Thursday in Los Angeles. Her longtime manager, Roger Paul, said the cause was ovarian cancer. She rose to national fame with a comedy special on HBO in 1987, 'Women of the Night', in which she starred alongside Ellen DeGeneres.

362.title: Luxury yacht owned by sanctioned Russian oligarch docks in Hong Kong
362.article_body: A luxury yacht belonging to sanctioned Russian oligarch Alexey Mordashov has docked in Hong Kong waters. Mordashov was among a number of Russian oligarchs sanctioned by the European Union and the US after Russia invaded Ukraine. The megayacht Nord, worth over $500 million, arrived in Hong Kong on October 5 after travelling for over a week from Russia's Vladivostok.

363.title: Aaditya was enjoying at Swiss pub when Uddhav was hospitalised: MP
363.article_body: MP Rahul Shewale has accused Maharashtra's former Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray of enjoying himself at a pub in Switzerland when his father, Uddhav Thackeray, was hospitalised in May. Aaditya had visited Switzerland to inaugurate the Maharashtra Pavilion at the World Economic Forum. Recently, former CM Uddhav Thackeray said rebel Shiv Sena leaders betrayed him when he was hospitalised.

364.title: Speed limit for Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway set at 120 km/hr
364.article_body: The Maharashtra government has announced a speed limit for the Mumbai-Nagpur Samruddhi Expressway. Vehicles can run at a speed of 100 to 120 km/hr. However, entry of two-wheelers, rickshaws and four-wheeler rickshaws has been barred on the expressway. The government also announced that the goods carrier vehicles can only run at a maximum speed of 80 km/hr.

365.title: 'Indians largest group that overstays visa,' says UK minister; India responds
365.article_body: Indian-origin UK Home Secretary Suella Braverman has said that the Migration and Mobility Partnership signed between India and UK last year hasn't "worked well". She said Indians were the "largest group of people who overstay" their visas in the UK. Reacting to her remarks, the Indian High Commission said the comments "may not be appropriate" as negotiations are underway.

366.title: Documentary on director SS Rajamouli in the works: Reports
366.article_body: A documentary on filmmaker SS Rajamouli is in the works, as per reports. The documentary, which pays an ode to the filmmaker and traces his journey and the laurels that he has brought to our industry, went on floors this week in Hyderabad, a source quoted by the report said. Rajamouli is currently working on a film with Mahesh Babu.

367.title: Man booked for abetting 24-year-old wife's suicide in Thane
367.article_body: A man was booked after his 24-year-old wife died by suicide due to alleged harassment in Thane, Maharashtra. The accused allegedly used to beat his wife and also threatened to divorce her, the deceased's father said in his complaint. The deceased hanged herself in her house on September 23, police said. Notably, no arrest has been made so far.

368.title: Beware of 5G fraudsters duping people on pretext of upgrading SIMs: Hyd Police
368.article_body: Hyderabad Police has warned the citizens of fraudsters duping people on the pretext of upgrading their SIMs to 5G services. Several complaints of people losing money from bank accounts after responding to unsolicited links received on phones have been reported ever since the news of 5G rollout came out. "We urge...public to not respond to any such messages," police said.

369.title: Ukraine promises 'life' & 'safety' to Russian troops who lay down arms
369.article_body: Ukraine's Defence Minister Oleksii Reznikov on Friday called on Russian troops to lay down their arms, promising them "life and safety". "You can still save Russia from tragedy and the Russian army from humiliation," Reznikov said in Russian in a video addressed to Russian troops. He further said that Russian troops have been "deceived and betrayed" by the Kremlin.

370.title: Indian crypto exchange ZebPay seeks Singapore permit, assesses UAE
370.article_body: India-based cryptocurrency exchange platform ZebPay has applied for a licence in Singapore and is assessing the potential of a similar step in the UAE, outgoing CEO Avinash Shekhar told Bloomberg. "The 1% transaction tax the nation imposed on crypto this year is hurting trading volumes," he said. Shekhar added that ZebPay implemented salary cuts, including 6% drop for non-management staff.

371.title: Adidas puts partnership with Kanye West's Yeezy under review
371.article_body: Adidas on Thursday said it has put its partnership with rapper Kanye West's Yeezy brand under review. The decision was taken "after repeated efforts to privately resolve the situation", the company said, adding, "We...recognise that...successful partnerships are rooted in mutual respect and shared values." Kanye, now known as Ye, responded to the news and said Adidas "stole" his designs.

372.title: Happy b'day to someone always on energy saving mode: Yuvraj to Zaheer
372.article_body: Yuvraj Singh took to Twitter to wish ex-Team India pacer Zaheer Khan on his 44th birthday, terming him as someone who is "always on energy saving mode". "Wishing you a day as wonderful as you are brother! Lots of love always," added Yuvraj in his tweet. "Happy [birthday] Zak...Lots of love," read a tweet from Harbhajan Singh.

373.title: Vedanta Chairman to seek shareholders' nod to use firm's cash reserves
373.article_body: Billionaire Chairman Anil Agarwal's Vedanta Resources Limited will seek the approval of Vedanta Limited's shareholders on October 11 on a company plan to move money out of its reserves and into its balance sheet. The move will increase the probability that the funds will be used for dividends. London-based Vedanta Resources uses dividends from its Indian unit to repay debts.

374.title: Video shows Anushka getting annoyed at photographers allegedly clicking Vamika's pics
374.article_body: A video shows actress Anushka Sharma getting annoyed at photographers for allegedly clicking pictures of her daughter Vamika at the airport. After noticing that photographers were recording videos, she gestured at them to stop. A photographer is heard saying, "We aren't taking Vamika's pictures." She posed with cricketer-husband Virat Kohli after he ensured that Vamika was out of the frame.

375.title: Scan a QR code, get token to make OPD registration in Delhi hospitals
375.article_body: A faster OPD registration service has been launched at Delhi government hospitals. To use the service, people must scan the QR code placed at OPD registration counters and fill in details like their name, age, address, mobile number etc. A token will be sent to their phones which can be used to collect their outpatient (OP) slip for doctor consultation.

376.title: Bhagwat’s speech aimed at 'unleashing communal animosity': Kerala CM
376.article_body: Reacting to RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat’s community-based population imbalance remark, Kerala CM P Vijayan alleged that it was a false propaganda aimed at "unleashing communal animosity" in the country. Earlier on Wednesday, Bhagwat had said that the nation should frame a comprehensive population control policy applicable to all social groups equally and flagged the issue of demographic imbalance.

377.title: 9-member task force formed to monitor cheetahs in Kuno National Park
377.article_body: The central government has constituted a nine-member task force for monitoring cheetahs in Madhya Pradesh's Kuno National Park and other areas. The team will also monitor the hunting skills and adaptations of the cheetahs. Earlier, PM Narendra Modi had said, "A decision will be taken after a few months and then you will be able to see the cheetahs."

378.title: Peace Nobel awarded to Ales Bialiatski, 2 human rights organisations from Russia, Ukraine
378.article_body: The Norwegian Nobel Committee on Friday awarded the 2022 Nobel Peace Prize to human rights advocate Ales Bialiatski from Belarus, the Russian human rights organisation Memorial and the Ukrainian human rights organisation Center for Civil Liberties. "They have for many years promoted the right to criticise power and protect the fundamental rights of citizens," the Norwegian Nobel Committee said.

379.title: Completely false: Xiaomi on report of moving India operations to Pakistan
379.article_body: Xiaomi has denied a report claiming that the Chinese electronics maker may move its India operations to Pakistan after the government froze its assets worth ₹5,551.27 crore. Xiaomi said the report is "completely false and baseless". The company added, "99% of our smartphones & 100% of our TVs are made in India. We'll take all measures to protect our reputation."

380.title: FIR filed against owners of buffaloes hit by Vande Bharat Express
380.article_body: The Railway Protection Force in Gujarat registered a case against the owners of buffaloes that were hit by the Mumbai-Gandhinagar Vande Bharat Express, officials said on Friday. The nose cone cover of the driver coach of the train, which got damaged after hitting the buffaloes, was replaced with a new one in Mumbai. Four buffaloes were killed in the incident.

381.title: US consulate in Hyd to auction laptops, 2-wheelers, TVs; full list shared
381.article_body: US consulate in Hyderabad is going to conduct an online auction for four-wheelers, two-wheelers, televisions, IT equipment and other items. A tweet shared by the consulate listed all the things that will be auctioned. The list includes queen mattress, table lamp, multiple dining chairs, television, television cabinet, book cases, CPUs, monitors and other things.

382.title: I lose out on a lot as I am Lionel Messi, my children suffer: Messi
382.article_body: Lionel Messi said he loses out on a lot due to his identity as a popular footballer, adding his children "suffer". "We forbid ourselves from doing many things. It would be nice to have a moment alone with your family," he stated. Talking about shifting to Paris in 2021, Messi said, "I remember leaving...[my kids] at school and...suffering for them."

383.title: US' largest retailer Walmart to lay off 1,458 workers in Atlanta
383.article_body: Walmart is planning to fire 1,458 workers at the e-commerce fulfilment centre in Atlanta. The company's spokesperson, Scott Pope, said affected workers are being assisted with paid job searches and some employees have been re-hired at other Walmart stores. Earlier on Thursday, Walmart announced that it would acquire a robotics and automation firm, Alert Innovation, to help speed up deliveries.

384.title: India operations effectively halted: Xiaomi to HC on $676-mn assets freeze
384.article_body: The Karnataka High Court on Thursday declined to lift a freeze on Xiaomi's assets worth $676 million. Xiaomi denied any wrongdoing and said it "is severely disproportionate and has effectively halted the operations" in India. Enforcement Directorate had in April ordered the seizure of Xiaomi India's assets for illegally remitting foreign exchange outside India under the guise of royalty payments.

385.title: Villagers lynch man who allegedly raped 9-yr-old girl in Bihar
385.article_body: Villagers lynched a man who allegedly raped a nine-year-old girl in Bihar's Katihar on Thursday, police said. The incident occurred when the villagers apparently caught the man red-handed and brutally assaulted him after tying him to a tree. The villagers reached the scene after hearing the girl cry out for help while the man raped her, an investigating officer said.

386.title: US sanctions Myanmar businessmen over Russian arms deals
386.article_body: The US has imposed sanctions on a Burmese company and its owners for allegedly procuring Russian-made weapons and aircraft from Belarus for the Myanmar military junta that seized control of the country in last year's coup. Along with the owners of Dynasty International, Aung Moe Myint and Hlaing Moe Myint, the company's Director, Myo Thitsar, was also sanctioned.

387.title: Credit Suisse to buy back $3 billion debt to reassure investors
387.article_body: Credit Suisse on Friday said it will buy back up to 3 billion Swiss francs ($3 billion) of debt to reassure investors. The move trims the debt burden of the Switzerland-headquartered bank even as its shares touched a record low on October 3 to 3.52 Swiss francs ($3.7). The bank has lost about 60% of its market value this year.

388.title: Police officer demands ₹5 lakh extortion money in Pune; booked
388.article_body: Pune's Vimantal police have filed a case against a police officer for allegedly demanding ₹5 lakh extortion money from a petrol pump owner for the smooth functioning of his business. According to the complaint, the incident took place in September and the accused apparently threatened the petrol pump's owner with "dire consequences" if he failed to pay the money.

389.title: He somehow cleared class 12, only wanted to play cricket: Patidar's father
389.article_body: Batter Rajat Patidar's father Manohar Patidar said he wasn't interested in anything else apart from cricket, adding that he somehow managed to clear Class 12. "His movement was restricted from home to the ground (for practice)," he stated. Reacting to Rajat receiving his maiden Team India call-up for the ODI series against South Africa, Manohar said, "It is very normal."

390.title: Woman finds pencil in Burger King meal in UK; shares pic as staff tell her 'Not to worry'
390.article_body: A woman found a pencil in her Burger King meal in UK's Bootle. Leanne Daly shared a pic of the pencil that she found in her burger after staff at the Burger King outlet told her "not to worry". "We apologise for the impact this incident has caused and have investigated the matter raised," a spokesperson said.

391.title: Ola, Uber, Rapido's auto services declared illegal in B'luru, ordered to discontinue
391.article_body: Karnataka Transport Department has issued notices to cab aggregators like Ola, Uber, and Rapido, ordering them to discontinue their auto services in Bengaluru, calling it illegal. The development comes after complaints of aggregators charging ₹100 for a 2 km auto ride. "Submit an explanation about illegal autorickshaw operation...within 3 days. If not, legal action will be taken," the notice said.

392.title: Dabur India stock falls after it expects Q2 margin to be hit
392.article_body: Dabur India's stock traded lower on Friday, a day after the FMCG major said in its business update for the September quarter that the geopolitical environment continued to have a high inflationary impact on its business. Dabur said its operating margin could be 150-200 basis points lower year-on-year. Its shares were trading 1.87% lower on the BSE at 11:10 am.

393.title: Global economy moving towards greater uncertainty: IMF chief
393.article_body: International Monetary Fund (IMF) chief Kristalina Georgieva said that the global economy is moving from a world of relative predictability to one of greater uncertainty. She warned that about one-third of the world economy will experience at least two consecutive quarters of contraction. IMF in July slashed its growth forecast for this year to 3.2% and to 2.9% for 2023.

394.title: Upset over 14-yr-old son's suicide after being scolded, Chennai man kills self
394.article_body: A 40-year-old man died by suicide after his son killed himself in Chennai. The 14-year-old boy allegedly died by suicide after being scolded by his father over playing mobile games. The son took the step when he was alone in the house. The man locked himself in a room after finding out about his son's death and died by suicide.

395.title: 2 youths saved from getting washed away in U'khand; video surfaces
395.article_body: Two youths from Uttar Pradesh were saved from getting washed away in a river at Sharda Ghat in Uttarakhand's Tanakpur by a swimmer of the state police and a local youth, police tweeted on Thursday. The police also shared a video of the incident, which shows the swimmer and the local youth bringing the duo to the shore.

396.title: US & South Korea hold maritime drills after North Korea's missile launch
396.article_body: The US and South Korea held joint maritime drills on South Korea's east coast, country's Joint Chiefs of Staff said. The drills, involving a US aircraft carrier, come after North Korea launched ballistic missiles into the sea on Thursday and flew warplanes near the border with South Korea. The US, Japan and South Korea recently held trilateral missile defence exercises.

397.title: 2 killed, 6 wounded after man goes on stabbing spree along Las Vegas Strip
397.article_body: At least two people have been killed and six others have been wounded after a man armed with a large kitchen knife went on a stabbing spree along the casino-lined Las Vegas Strip in the US on Thursday, officials said. The suspect, who was described as a Hispanic man in his 30s, was taken into custody soon after the attack.

398.title: 3 more bodies recovered, death toll reaches 19 in Uttarkashi avalanche
398.article_body: At least three more bodies were recovered from the site of an avalanche at Draupadi Ka Danda-2 peak in Uttarakhand's Uttarkashi district, the Nehru Institute of Mountaineering (NIM) said on Friday. The death toll has now climbed to 19, it added. While 17 of these bodies are of trainee mountaineers, two are of their instructors, it further said.

399.title: 500 raids in 3 months, nothing found: Kejriwal as ED raids 35 sites
399.article_body: Delhi CM Arvind Kejriwal on Friday reacted to Enforcement Directorate (ED) carrying out searches at around 35 locations in connection with the Delhi excise policy case, alleging that all the officials "are trying to find proof against...[Deputy CM Manish Sisodia]". "Over 500 raids, more than 300 CBI/ED officials have been working 24x7 for three months...Nothing has been found," he added.

400.title: 27-year-old wanted criminal arrested after shootout in Noida Film City
400.article_body: A 27-year-old criminal, identified as Danish who is wanted in multiple cases, was arrested following a shootout in Noida Film City on Friday, police said. "A police check was set up near Brahmaputra Market...Danish was intercepted...he fled the spot. Nearby police posts were alerted about the development," police added. An associate of Danish who was with him escaped, police stated.
